title: C++ Software Engineer, Autonomous Systems
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 As a C++ Software Engineer within the Motion Planning & Decision Making group, you will have the opportunity to apply your technical skills to a variety of system components & modules aiming to increase the performance of the (Decision-making) team’s outcome and thereby of the Autonomous Transport Solutions as a whole. Your code will be connected with a variety of other components, hence it has to be robust, and easy to debug and maintain. You will always strive towards applying modern best software practices. You will be developing system tools to tackle current problems and exploring solutions for future functions. You will be contributing to systemizing new features on a product level, testing and validating the code to ensure the system- and functional stability of our stack, and you will perform safety and risk analysis to ensure production readiness. You will have the opportunity to test the outcome in real vehicles on Scania’s test track for autonomous vehicles.
   

  

 We also use simulation models for testing, analysis and further development. C++ is the main coding language used in autonomous software development, but we also have both inhouse and external supplementary tools that are written in Python or Matlab.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Write, debug and maintain robust C++ software to various components such as situation awareness, autonomous vehicle operational state, etc.
* Advocate for best coding practices amongst the group, build tools helping engineers to write better code
* Optimize hardware resources usage
* Systemizing features on a product level, including safety and security
* Troubleshooting, failure mode analysis, customer report diagnosis
* Testing in vehicles on Scania’s test track for autonomous vehicles


**Who You Are**
* Experienced in programming C/C++ software, including modern C/C++ (C++14/17/20)
* Strong software engineering skills such as designing, evaluating, testing, and maintaining software systems, IT documentation, ensuring platform compatibility
* Experience or familiarity with Robotics, Machine Learning & related software concepts a plus
* Proficient in developing software on a Linux host, for embedded Linux targets (cross-compilation, etc.) a plus
* Passion for technology and software, hands-on attitude, eagerness to make things happen, strong desire to learn, ability to collaborate, high work ethic
* MSc in Computer Science, Applied Physics, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, proof of exceptional skills in related fields with practical software engineering experience, or equivalent
* Fluency in English


 We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experience and perspectives are valuable to us.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 We offer a healthy and inspiring workplace, with great respect for the individual, where you have many opportunities to shape your work and your future. Your personal and professional development is important and something we encourage and support, for example by providing extensive technical or leadership training programs.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes. Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-04-12.
   

  

 Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Christos Koniaris, Engineering Manager – Motion Planning & Decision Making, christos.koniaris@scania.com, +46 76 516 68 25.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Senior Software Developer, Team GO Cards (Full-time; m/f/d)
description:
*At Nexus, part of French IN Groupe, we secure the new society that emerges in the ever-expanding world of digital transformation. By challenging ourselves to go further and do better, we’re developing technology for high-demand global clients. Nexus’ Smart ID solutions and IoT platforms are changing how we perceive trusted identities. Do you want to be a part of our journey?*
 Claes Rosenberg, our Head of GO Cards and his team, are looking to strengthen the team with a talented Senior Software Developer to join our Stockholm office.
   

  

**What We Offer You**
* Be part of a high impact product (real users will use your features, no scrap products or maybes) with short release cycles and products we build from scratch.
* A good and small team! We are uncomplicated and easy-going people, highly skilled and hard working.
* Close connection to both customers and production, it is easy to get a sense of the whole circle
* A modern hybrid architecture deployed in the cloud


 Want to know more? Check out our value proposition: To work with us!
   

  

**What You’ll Do At Nexus**
 The product portfolio you will be joining is Nexus Go Cards, an online service which our customers use to order highly secure and customized identity cards (smart cards), key fobs, and accessories. It is a flexible and secure, cloud-based solution where our customers can choose to order directly via our online card management portal or by doing a system integration via API.
   

  

 You collaborate closely with other team members, departments, and customers/partners to take end-to-end responsibility for the entire service, enabling us to deliver great things fast. Agile methods, constant improvement and continuous deployment is part of the team DNA.
   

  

 As mentioned, we are a small team, and you will work through the whole tech stack, which for us includes everything from UI portals to backend services, databases and integration to external services, such as ERP systems and laser engravers.
   

  

 As an Identity management company, security is key to everything we do and security by design should be part of your day-to-day.
   

  

 As a Senior Software Developer, your responsibilities include but are not limited to:
   

  

* Full stack role, everything from UI portals to backend services, databases and integration to external services, such as ERP systems and laser engravers
* Develop, improve and maintain our services
* Implement, quality assure and deploy new features
* Improve and develop the usage of Azure


**Some of our Tech Stack:** 
 Java, Spring Boot, Angular, REST, GIT, Docker, Kubernetes, SonarQube, Microservice, Azure DevOps, Open ID Connect, SAML
   

  

**About You**
* We believe you are curious and innovative.
* You like to cooperate and work with different stakeholders.
* You enjoy inspiring people around you.
* You see yourself as a humble and pragmatic person.
* You take pleasure in working independently and driving topics.
* Your key focus is the end user and their experience.


**Qualifications**
* You have a lot of experience in your backpack, contributing to interesting development activities and implementation of new features for the services
* Longstanding experience in product development in Java, Spring Boot and DevOps tools
* Front end experience is required for this role, for example with Angular
* Cloud experience is crucial, preferably in Azure, Docker and / or Kubernetes
* Good knowledge and understanding about Microservices
* Strong analytical skills with demonstrated problem solving ability.
* Working proficiency level in English


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience in cyber security is beneficial.
* For this role, we believe it is highly advantageous to be proficient in Swedish. This due to the fact we follow a framework (ID06) where all documentation is written in Swedish.


**Not sure you meet 100% of the qualifications?**
 At Nexus, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team - so if your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying.
   

  

**Background check**
 Transparency, security, and trust are the core of our company; therefore, the final candidate will be subjected to a background check before training.
   

  

 Nexus is an equal-opportunity employer. We truly believe in being ONE Nexus. You are welcomed at Nexus for who you are, no matter where you come from or what you look like. Our technology is for everyone, and so is our workplace. So, bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background to thrive, collaborate, and be forward-thinking! It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep innovating the way we secure the world.

title: Senior Embedded C++ SW Developer
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 I denna roll kommer du att arbeta med utveckling av inbyggd mjukvara i C++, med fokus på systemnära programmering nära hårdvaran. Du kommer att ingå i ett tekniskt kompetent team och bidra till utveckling, testning och optimering av mjukvara i en Linux- och FreeRTOS-miljö.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av Embedded C++-utveckling.
* Erfarenhet av systemnära programmering.
* Vana att arbeta i Linux-miljö.
* Goda kunskaper i Git och Jenkins.
* Erfarenhet av FreeRTOS.
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och i team.
* Erfarenhet av Python.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 02-04-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Mobile Android Developer
description:
The Digital and Access Solutions (DAS) business segment within the EMEIA Division is looking for an Android Developer to join the Electronic Access Control (EAC) product unit.
   

  

 If you are passionate about mobile app development and have a track record of building successful Android applications, we want to hear from you!
   

  

 Join our team based in Stockholm, Sweden and enjoy a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

**What You Would Do As Our Mobile Android Developer**
 As an Android Developer you will develop mobile applications for our different Electronic Access Control systems. You would develop applications for configuration and operations of our wireless locks and systems. You will join a cross functional agile software team with mobile and cloud developers, QAs and a UX designer. You will work closely with our firmware team regarding communication with the devices. On top of this you will cooperate with product management on the app requirements.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and release new features
* Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications
* Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* At least three years' experience of mobile Android app development, preferably with Kotlin.
* Experience with RESTful APIs and integration with cloud services.
* Experience with Jetpack Compose and good understanding of Android release cycle.
* Strong command of written and spoken English.


 Ideally, you have experience working with several of the following: developing mobile applications for connected IoT devices, BLE communication, APIs for offline storage, threading and performance tuning, and security technologies such as TLS, MFA, OAuth, and PKI. Experience with cross-platform languages such as React Native (Expo), Kotlin Multi-Platform, or Flutter is nice to have but not a requirement. Additionally, familiarity with the SAFe agile methodology is beneficial.
   

  

 Furthermore, you share our belief in lean and agile values, embracing an open mindset and cross-functional teams where multiple competencies collaborate to drive successful projects.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* The opportunity to grow your skills in a versatile way and develop your career in a respected global group.
* Agile and innovative working environment.
* Motivated and encouraging team around you.
* Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere.


**We review applications regularly, so don't wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here.
   

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Mona Yusefi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at mona.yusefi@assaabloy.com.
   

  

 Depending on the risk profile for the role, a background screening will need to be performed. Final candidates may therefore be a subject to a background screening. The performance of a background check is subject to consent and based on our Applicant Privacy Notice.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations Lead/Developer
description:
Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations Developer
 



  





 Whitehall Resources are currently looking for a Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations Lead based in Sweden for an initial 9 Month contract.
 



  





**\*\*\* MUST BE A SWEDISH CITIZEN AND SWEDISH SPEAKING \*\*\***




  





**Job Spec:** 



* Will act as stream lead in project team delivery, responsible for FRD/FDDs, plan, prepare, execute workshops, create documentation, test cases, execute tests.
* Reporting to project manager, supported by solution architect.
* Develop customization and integrations.

title: iOS Developer
description:
Marshall Group is the audio, tech and design powerhouse uniting musicians and music lovers through genre-breaking audio innovation. We are home to Marshall, Natal Drums, Urbanears and adidas headphones.
   

  

 For over sixty years, we’ve amplified the sound of the world’s most talented artists. We’ve brought their music to crowds and solo listeners everywhere. We give sound a design that resonates with ears and eyes, as well as at a deeper cultural level. No matter the scene or music genre, we aim to excite, intrigue and surprise.
   

  

 Bridging iconic rock ‘n’ roll heritage with cutting-edge innovation and culture-driven brand-building, our group activities span professional music equipment, consumer electronics, live events, a record label, and more.
   

  

 We empower around 800 highly talented people across 8 global locations. Our products are sold in over 90 markets worldwide, totalling a combined annual turnover of USD 360 million.
   

  

***Right now,***
 we need to strengthen our Application Development team with an iOS developer that will be working with our cross-functional teams. The world of audio is changing. Smart speakers and True Wireless headphones are turning audio into a high-tech industry. In the last few years, our products have gone from simple wired devices to connected and complex IoT devices. We are now focusing on evolving our mobile app and the added value it can provide to our users.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Maintain and develop iOS mobile apps for the Marshall Brand.
* Contribute to the design and implemention of a scalable solution for our new iOS platform.
* Collaborate closely with our UX and firmware teams in developing and implementing our new features and functions.
* Support and participate in the testing and evaluation of the app's integration with the firmware.
* Drive knowledge-sharing sessions to promote new ideas and innovation.
* Define processes and frameworks for our newly established team.
* Prototyping new ideas to make them come true, both individually and across teams.


**Who We’re Looking For**
 We are looking for an experienced iOS developer with a collaborative mindset who cooperates well internally and externally. To succeed in this role, you need to be a committed driver with a problem-solving approach, focused on building quality products to create great user experiences together with the UX and design team. We believe you have a great passion for new technologies, new trends, and software development. You get excited by the idea of creating an amazing app experience that resonates with people not only on a functional level but also on an emotional level.
   

  

**You Probably Have The Following Experiences & Skills**
* 5+ years experience in iOS app development
* Experience working with Swift, Swift UI and Swift package manager.
* Proficient in modern iOS design patterns (for ex. MVVM, dependency injection)
* Strong understanding of the Combine framework
* Familiarity interacting with Firebase and Clean Architecture
* Good understanding of the developer testing infrastructure (Unit testing, UI tests, Jenkins, etc.)


 It's beneficial if you understand the Bluetooth stack, communication over GATT and AVKit; and WiFi stack.
   

  

 We thrive to foster an inclusive workplace, and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, disability, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, or marital status. We firmly believe that Marshall thrives when our employees do, and it will in the end lead to better experiences for our consumers.
   

  

 We encourage applications from all over the world. To enable transitioning from another country for a role at Marshall, we offer re-location support. This support is tailored for each role but always includes visa application, local authority registration, and home finding service. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions.
   

  

**Does this sound like you?**
 If you have a passion for App development and want to work for a growing company with a start-up mindset, this job is a perfect match for you. Please send us your resume as soon as possible as we are reviewing candidates continuously.
   

  

*We look forward to reviewing your application!*

title: Java Product Manager
description:
*Mojang Studios is best known as the creators of Minecraft, but we’re also on a mission* 
*–* 
*to build a better world through the power of play.*
*Why play? Well, play is at the heart of everything we do. It’s the blocky backbone of our games, the core of our development philosophy, and even the origin of our name. From the relentless experimentation of our endlessly inspiring community to the classrooms where Minecraft has become an essential teaching tool, play is the bedrock of our existence.*
 The team working with Java Platform is looking for a Product Manager that will ensure our vision and roadmaps are in line with business objectives and technically sound. As Product Manager you will work closely with your production team, the team leadership, as well as with peers across different parts of the organization.
   

  

**In This Role You Will Be**
* Ensuring that the team is a healthy team doing the right things at the right time.
* Building and owning a platform with a real impact on millions of Minecraft players.
* Communicate and create engagement around the vision, roadmap, and key metrics within your team and throughout Mojang Studios.
* Using data as well as input from our community to get learnings and to validate your strategy.
* The expert in knowing who your customer is and what problems they have that you can solve for now and in the future.
* Looking at both the gaming market and the current tech trends to influence the platform strategy.
* Collaborate closely with other Product leaders at Mojang Studios, the different game teams, other services teams as well as the Bedrock Platform.


  

  

**To succeed in this role, we believe you have experience in:** 
  

  

* Creating clarity and set priority for your team
* Experience in stakeholder management
* Platform experience, preferably from game engine areas
* Working in a technical agile environment
* Building teams with many dependencies supporting other teams
* Strong communication, problem-solving skills and extensive experience with situational leadership
* Interest in gaming, and maybe even a passion for Minecraft


**About This Role**
 This is a full-time role based in Stockholm with a hybrid remote working model that requires you to be onsite every week. You'll collaborate closely with our studio colleagues in Redmond, USA, and across various disciplines. This position has off hour meetings occasionally mainly with West coast USA representatives.
   

  

*We’re looking for candidates who are eligible to work in Sweden. Since our hybrid work model requires two onsite days per week, you’ll need to be based in Stockholm to collaborate with your team and soak up the studio energy.*
*We are happy to welcome international talent and talent outside Stockholm, however we will not be able to financially support you relocation. If you are located out of Stockholm relocation is a must.*
**Mojang Studios**
*Mojang Studios is a Microsoft-owned game developer. The company was founded in Stockholm, Sweden and has offices around the world, including Stockholm, Redmond, Tokyo, London, and Shanghai. We’re always working on new and exciting ways to expand the Minecraft universe.*
*Our community is global and incredibly diverse. We keep this in mind when developing anything, as we want people to feel included in Minecraft. And in recruiting, our goal is to make Mojang Studios as diverse as our community.*
*We got started as a tiny indie developer, and part of our culture still reflects that heritage. But we’re also proud to belong to Xbox Game Studios, which creates unique opportunities to grow and develop.*
*To help us achieve amazing things, we have built an equally amazing studio space. Situated right on the water by Söder Mälarstrand, it’s filled to the brim with all the tools, toys and caffeine required to create world-class entertainment.*
*But in the end, it’s the people of Mojang Studios that make this place truly special. When you join, you’ll find yourself in the company of incredibly bright, warm, and creative individuals – all united and working toward a single goal. Come help us reach it!*
***Important note on resumes**
 Please make sure that
 **all** 
 the information in your resume is accurate because we will conduct a thorough background check. Any discrepancies will lower your chances of getting to the next interview stage and we’d hate to miss out on an awesome candidate! Double check that any gap years are reflected in your history, and that your education and work experience are completely accurate. Good luck!*

title: .NET Developer with a passion to grow into cyber security in Operational Security Center | SEB, Solna
description:
Are you a talented senior developer with a passion for coding, the ability to work independently as a .NET developer (a mandatory requirement), and a keen interest to learn and grow within the cybersecurity area? Join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding journey, working with our Operational Security Center team as a developer in areas and tooling such as Security Engineering, Vulnerability Management, Penetration Testing services, and more.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Developer, you will play a crucial role in contributing to and developing our technical solutions across all areas within the Operational Security Center. You’ll collaborate with our Solution Architect and other developers within Infrastructure & Security to design and implement cutting-edge solutions. An interest in growing within the Cybersecurity field is essential.
   

  

**You’ll work on innovative cybersecurity solutions and cutting-edge projects, including:**
* Coding a Vulnerability Management Platform, including database design and integrations.
* Quality Assurance/Testing
* Developing automation tools for Penetration Testing services.
* Enhancing Incident Response capabilities or creating “detect tooling.”
* You’ll have the opportunity to push the boundaries of your skills and contribute to shaping both your future and that of the team.


**Key Responsibilities:**
* Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code.
* Continuously identify opportunities for innovation.
* Conduct system analysis and troubleshoot issues.
* Collaborate with developers within the OSC team.
* To Thrive in This Role, We Believe You Have:
* Full-stack developer skills (with an emphasis on back-end).
* Ability to work independently as a .NET developer.
* Advanced programming skills in .NET.
* Proficiency in other programming languages.
* A habit of ideating, prototyping, and verifying several solutions to determine the best approach.
* Familiarity with DevSecOps practices.
* Strong communication skills in both Swedish and English.
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Teamwork and communication abilities.


**What We Offer:**
* A flat hierarchy and openness to sharing ideas, opinions, and viewpoints.
* A collaborative and dynamic work environment.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.
* A competitive compensation and benefits package.
* A hybrid workplace model.
* Join us to make an impact and advance your career in both development and cybersecurity!


 Ready to join?
   

  

 Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to this role. Feel free to send in your application today, but no later than March 27th, 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact hiring manager, Torbjörn Askenberg by mail torbjorn.askenberg @seb.se, but we will not be able to process applications via email.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Frontend-utvecklare
description:
Är du en passionerad frontend-utvecklare som vill vara med och forma framtidens digitala upplevelser? Valtech söker en erfaren och driven Frontend-utvecklare för vårt team i Stockholm. Om du är en kreativ problemlösare och vill arbeta i en innovativ och samarbetsorienterad miljö, då kan detta vara rollen för dig. Ansök nu och bli en del av Valtech!
   

  

**Om** 
**rollen**
 Som Frontend-utvecklare och konsult på Valtech kommer du att spela en central roll i att leverera högkvalitativa, skalbara och användarvänliga lösningar till våra kunder. Du kommer att arbeta nära kundens affärsbehov och se till att våra lösningar inte bara möter, utan överträffar deras förväntningar.
   

  

 Din dagliga arbetsmiljö kommer att vara dynamisk och inkluderande, där du samarbetar med både interna team och kunder för att säkerställa att projekten levereras effektivt och enligt plan. Du kommer att vara delaktig i alla faser av projektet – från initial planering till slutleverans.
   

  

**Dina** 
**arbetsuppgifter**
* Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team för att designa och utveckla frontend-lösningar som möter kundens krav och förväntningar
* Bidra till kontinuerlig förbättring av våra utvecklingsmetoder och processer
* Aktivt delta i kundmöten, workshops och presentationer för att säkerställa att projektet löper smidigt och transparent
* Arbeta nära kund och interna team för att förstå och lösa deras tekniska och affärsmässiga utmaningar


**Vem** 
**är du?**
 Vi söker dig som har minst 5 års erfarenhet inom frontend-utveckling och som brinner för att bygga användarvänliga och skalbara lösningar. Du är en teamspelare som trivs med att arbeta i en snabb och flexibel arbetsmiljö, och du har förmågan att leverera högkvalitativa lösningar under tidspress.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet från digitalbyråer, IT-konsultföretag eller start-ups där snabbhet och anpassningsförmåga varit avgörande för framgång.
   

  

**Vi Ser Att Du Har Erfarenhet Inom Följande**
* Relevant teknisk utbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av frontend-utveckling, med fokus på moderna frontend-stackar
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med teknologier som React, Vue, Next.js eller andra liknande ramverk
* Stark kunskap i JavaScript, HTML och CSS
* Erfarenhet av API-integrationer och GraphQL
* Kunskap om tillgänglighetsstandarder (t.ex. WCAG) för att bygga inkluderande webbapplikationer
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med agila verktyg som Jira och Confluence
* Förmåga att kommunicera effektivt med intressenter och identifiera lösningar som tillför värde till projekten
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift


**Vad** 
**kan du förvänta dig av oss?**
 På Valtech får du arbeta i en inkluderande och kreativ kultur där samarbete och ständig utveckling är i fokus. Vi värdesätter våra medarbetares välmående och ser till att du får de verktyg och den support du behöver för att trivas och utvecklas i din karriär.
   

  

 Du kommer att vara en del av ett globalt företag som leder den digitala upplevelsernas revolution och där du har möjlighet att ta ansvar, påverka och vara med och skapa innovativa lösningar. Våra kärnvärden – Share, Care, Dare – genomsyrar allt vi gör och skapar en arbetsplats där du kan växa både professionellt och personligt.
   

  

**Vill du** 
**vara en del av vårt team?**
 Ansök nu och bli en del av Valtech – där innovation och samarbete skapar framgång!

title: Utvecklare
description:
**Om Leonh** 




  





 Den snabbväxande utmanaren som skakar om corporate finance marknaden. Vi gör det andra i vår bransch bara snackar om: vi kombinerar smartare verktyg, modern teknik och en arbetskultur som gör jobbet både mer passionerat och givande. Nu letar vi efter en skicklig utvecklare – en kreativ problemlösare som vill bygga teknikfundamentet bakom vår framgång.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




  





 Som utvecklare på Leonh får du chansen att forma vår tekniska infrastruktur från grunden – och vi lovar att ingen dag är den andra lik och du kommer få jobba i hela teknikstacken. Hos oss handlar utveckling om att skapa verklig affärsnytta genom skalbar, robust och innovativ teknik. Bland annat kommer du jobba med:
 



  




* Designa och utveckla API:er och databasstrukturer som driver våra tjänster framåt.
* Implementera komplexa affärslogiker med TypeScript och React.
* Arbeta med PostgreSQL för att bygga effektiva och säkra datalösningar.
* Vara med och fatta tekniska beslut – vi tror på att ge utvecklare rätt mandat att påverka.
* Samarbeta i ett agilt team där idérikedom och proaktivitet uppmuntras varje dag.
* Vara med och driva våra AI-initiativ framåt.



  





**Varför Leonh?** 




  





 På Leonh kommer du in i ett snabbväxande bolag med höga ambitioner och stark entreprenörsanda. Vi erbjuder:
 



  




* En miljö där du faktiskt får bygga saker som används – inte bara koda features som aldrig ser dagens ljus
* Ett tight team där tekniska idéer uppskattas och snabbt förverkligas
* Stort fokus på individuell utveckling – vi vill att du ska fortsätta växa som utvecklare
* Ett roligt och framgångsdrivet arbetsklimat på ett centralt och luftigt kontor i Stockholm med mycket frihet under ansvar
* Möjlighet att vara med på vår spännande AI-transformation – vi står redo att implementera AI i finansbranschen



  





**Meriterande** 




  




* Tidigare erfarenhet av fintech eller finansiella tjänster
* Erfarenhet av Supabase
* Erfarenhet av att integrera eller utveckla AI-lösningar i produktionsmiljö
* Kunskap om LLM-teknologier, promptengineering eller embeddings
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med stora datavolymer



  





**Placering och kontakt** 




  





**﻿** 
 Tjänsten är placerad på Leonhs huvudkontor vid Karlaplan, StockholmTveka inte att kontakta mig (Henrik, CTO Leonh) vid frågor: henrik@leonh.se

title: Senior .Net utvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* .NET / .NET Framework
* C#
* Entity Framework
* WebAPI
* REST/SOAP API utveckling
* Azure DevOps
* SQL Server
* Visual Studio
* SQL och databasmodellering. (MS SQL server)


**Meriterande**
* Active Directory
* Microsoft Orchestrator
* XUnit
* Test-driven development (TDD)
* Powershell.
* Arbetat med E-handelssystem


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 18-03-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.
