title: Senior Frontend Engineer, Wolt Labs
description:
**About Wolt**
--------------



At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we're building the delivery of (almost) everything and you'll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.  

  

Working at Wolt isn't always easy, but it's definitely exciting. Here you'll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You'll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you're a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.


Are you an experienced software engineer ready to jump into an exciting role building something new on Wolt's consumer and payment domains? Do you strive for releasing high-quality code to production? If yes, we might just have the spot for you as we are looking for a Frontend Software Developer to join one of our Payments teams in building world-class payment infrastructure on our web app https://wolt.com/.



The Payments group owns the end-to-end payment UX, from users choosing a payment on checkout to users switching to external apps for authentications. It's a cross-functional team of frontend and backend engineers building product features end-to-end both within the team and in collaboration with other product and engineering teams (e.g. Consumer Web team).



You would be joining a new team with a real opportunity to contribute to the team's roadmap, tech choices, ways of working, and, naturally, be able to build all kinds of cool payments-related, user-facing features that will directly impact Wolt users' customer experience. Since the team is in its early stages, you would have a real impact developing the Web App's future, which is quite exciting really! Technical work you'll drill down into can relate to anything from implementing purchase order designs for checkout to integrating SDKs of new payment methods across our 30 countries.



The Payments group implements payment and fraud solutions on Wolt's checkout, as well as ensures that other quickly growing teams at Wolt can readily use payments based on their needs (i.e. multi-payment, bill-splitting, tipping, top ups, recurring payments, two-factor authentication on demand, etc). As Wolt operates internationally in 30 countries and over 200 cities these teams are in a vital spot for enabling a smooth checkout experience for our 15 million registered customers and ensuring stable, safe and error-proof money flows!



You can be based in our tech hubs Stockholm, Tallinn or Helsinki


**What we value**
-----------------



As the business is 24/7 so must our services be. We have lots of exciting and challenging engineering topics for seasoned engineers: state management, component architecture, code reusability, api designs and last but not least, test automation.



Ownership: We handle the whole development process (business logic, testing, database & data streaming, CI/CD, analytics, cloud) ourselves in an autonomous manner. Don't worry, we're not alone: We have support from central teams when we need help.



Technology: We use modern tools and technologies. Current stack in use is React + Typescript, React Testing Library, GitHub Actions, Playwright, Storybook and TanStack React Query.



Autonomy: We make the decisions as a team and group of teams! We are free to choose the technology stack and tools and make architectural decisions together. No top-down decisions!



Creativity: We're building lots of new stuff with minimal technical debt so you can focus on developing new features.



Diversity: We have different people with different backgrounds. Cultivating diversity and maintaining different opinions is the key to our success.


**Our humble expectations**
---------------------------



You might be the one we are looking for if you have several years of experience building apps using React & Typescript and delivering clean, reliable and maintainable code



We value a user centric mindset and strong sense of ownership where you take initiative and drive projects



On top of that, we value an attitude of constant improvements and also the ability to create things from scratch.



We are on the lookout for someone who is passionate about shipping high-quality software that solves customer and business problems. Technically, our ideal candidate knows their way around building top-notch frontend applications using React & TypeScript, while being highly passionate about design and enhancing user experience. If you're also all about crafting sleek, modern code that's as testable as it is maintainable, then you're our kind of person.



You are making the right choice to apply if you value taking ownership beyond the obvious, are strongly motivated to learn new things, don't shy away from making decisions, and are willing to collaborate with different teams across the organization. Throughout your career, you have worked with diverse teams. You've shipped beautiful greenfield projects from scratch, maintained horribly out-of-date old legacy projects, and everything in between. You understand the lifecycle of software products and have a pragmatic approach to finding the balance between crafting beautiful and scalable solutions while delivering incremental customer value along the way. ️



We work closely with our teammates and having a good connection with team members is essential. We understand that everyone has their own unique way of communicating with others. We expect you to be yourself, express your opinions, and work together with the rest of the team.


**Next steps**
--------------



The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!



The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you'll own a piece of the pie.

  

Notice to Applicants for Jobs Located in NYC or Remote Jobs Associated With Office in NYC Only


We use Covey as part of our hiring and/or promotional process for jobs in NYC and certain features may qualify it as an AEDT in NYC. As part of the hiring and/or promotion process, we provide Covey with job requirements and candidate submitted applications. We began using Covey Scout for Inbound from August 21, 2023, through December 21, 2023, and resumed using Covey Scout for Inbound again on June 29, 2024.


The Covey tool has been reviewed by an independent auditor. Results of the audit may be viewed here: Covey

**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
---------------------------------------------



We're committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That's why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Digital Project Leader
description:
We are looking for a **Digital Project Leader** to drive the development and implementation of impactful digital solutions. In this role, you will manage digital projects from strategy to execution, ensuring they align with business needs and deliver value. Acting as the bridge between business partners and product teams, you will collaborate closely with product leaders, UX designers, and solution architects to bring ideas to life.


Ready to make waves? This could be your perfect catch!

**Key Responsibilities**

  

* Plan and oversee digital projects, ensuring smooth execution and delivery.
* Maintain and prioritize the product backlog to meet business needs.
* Act as the link between technology, business, and users, ensuring seamless communication.
* Utilize Agile methods like Scrum or Kanban to optimize workflows.
* Drive initiatives such as web and app development, digital transformation, CRM and e-commerce solutions, and the implementation of new digital systems.
* Monitor KPIs and analyze data to drive continuous improvement and project success.

**Your** **profile**  

  

You have a strategic mindset and the ability to balance the big picture with attention to detail. A natural collaborator, you build trust with stakeholders and drive projects forward through clear communication and structured planning. You are unafraid of complex environments, seeing them as opportunities to create clarity and streamline processes. Curious and open-minded, you connect teams, foster innovation, and turn challenges into solutions.

* 

**Requirements**

  

* Experience with project methodologies (Agile, Scrum, Waterfall).
* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Knowledge of digital strategy and marketing.
* Data-driven marketing with the ability to make informed decisions.
* Ability to navigate digital platforms, tools, and technologies.


This is an exciting opportunity to shape digital transformation in a dynamic and innovative environment. If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you!

**Start**: During March  

**Workload**: 100%  

**Duration**: 5 months  

**Location**: At the client’s office in Älmhult with the possibility of remote work  

**Last day to apply**: March 14  

**Contact**: hej@fiskenivattnet.se

*Please note the last application date and know that we leave the jobpost on our web until the assignment is signed. Also kindly send your application in English.*

**About Fisken i vattnet**


Welcome to a thoughtful consultant agency with a variety of specialists for contemporary communication and marketing. For us, it's about conveying meaningful contexts where both you and we feel like the "fish in the water".

title: Localization Product Manager
description:
**About Us**


Keystone Education Group is a global leader in helping students find the right education, dedicated to delivering an exceptional experience to users worldwide. Our mission is to make our products accessible and engaging for diverse audiences by ensuring seamless localization and translation across our website and internal systems.


We’re looking for a Localization Product Manager to drive our localization efforts, providing key insights and recommendations on translation strategies and improving how our content resonates with international audiences.

**What You’ll Do**

* Analyze and assess localization needs across our website and internal systems.
* Provide data-driven recommendations to optimize localization, translation quality, and consistency.
* Execution & Ownership: Ability to not only recommend improvements but also manage daily localization tasks in product development.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineering, UX, content, and marketing, to ensure localization is the best practices.
* Identify and implement process improvements in translation workflows, tools, and vendor management.
* Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of localization efforts, leveraging analytics and user feedback.
* Stay up to date with industry trends and emerging technologies in localization and translation.

**What We’re Looking For**

* **Experience:** at least 2 years in localization, product management, or a related field.
* Knowledge of at least one industry TMS (Lokalise, Crowdin, Smartling, etc.)
* Terminology bases and translation memories management.
* Machine translation post-editing (MTPE), LLM-based translations and prompt engineering
* **Expertise:** Strong understanding of localization strategies, translation processes, and related tools.
* **Analytical Mindset:** Ability to interpret data, identify trends, and make informed recommendations.
* **Communication Skills:** Clear and concise communication with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* **Problem-Solving:** A proactive approach to identifying and resolving localization challenges.
* **Collaboration:** Comfortable working cross-functionally to align localization efforts with business goals.
* Experience with localization platforms and CMS tools.

**Nice-to-Haves**

* Familiarity with agile product development methodologies.
* Willingness to take on tasks and responsibilities from other product areas when needed.
* Fluency in one or more languages other than English.

**What can we offer you?**

* An International and open working atmosphere with colleagues of many nationalities.
* To be a part of a fast-growing company.
* Plenty of space for initiative and the ability to grow your own skills and experience.
* Awesome colleagues and a social working environment.
* Hybrid working, but with a team that also enjoys meeting up IRL and having a Friday beer or Monday breakfast at the office found centrally in Stockholm (or in Sheffield).
* To be a part of a team who cares deeply for our customers.

**What's the team like?**


You will join the Publishing Squad and be a part of a larger Product & tech team consisting of 30+ engineers and product managers from diverse backgrounds and experiences.


Collaborative, ambitious and driven best describes us. You will be joining a strong and growing team with great chemistry who are passionate about what they do and always go the extra mile to reach their goals.

 **Keystone Education Group**  

  

Keystone is trusted by more than 120 million unique prospective students every year to help students and learners make one of the most important decisions of their lifetimes, namely, which higher education degree program or course to attend.


In turn, Keystone helps over 5 500 education institutions reach, recruit, and enroll students in more than 190 countries, across 500+ student websites, including Masterstudies.com, Bachelorstudies.com, Educations.com, Studentum.se, and FindAMasters. Keystone also operates a range of other global student recruitment services, including Blueberry.nu, Keystone Sports and Keystone Apply.


Headquartered in Oslo, Norway, Keystone is backed by Viking Venture and Verdane, two leading Nordic venture firms. With offices across the Nordics, Germany, and the UK, Keystone has an international staff of more than 800+ employees. We are a vibrant and talented group of global citizens with a true passion for education and technology, and our vision is to help everyone in the world find the right education.


Please send us your application, in English, by hitting the button "Apply here!".

*Keystone is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are deeply committed to fostering an inclusive environment for all employees.*

title: Senior Digital Designer
description:
**Hi! We are Manyone**


Manyone is a strategic design consultancy. We're here to help transform and reimagine businesses by seamlessly blending strategy, creativity, and technology.

  

We're looking for someone far from ordinary—someone who brings energy, fresh ideas, and a sharp design mind. If you thrive in a fast-moving, exciting environment and can turn challenges into opportunities without losing your cool, we want to hear from you! At Manyone, we believe in designing a better future—one where creativity, strategy, and technology come together to shape extraordinary experiences.


Now, we're looking for a Senior Digital Designer to join our team in Malmö, bringing a blend of innovation, collaboration, and expertise to help businesses navigate what's next.


**About the role**  

As a Senior Digital Designer at Manyone Sweden, you'll work across disciplines and team boundaries to craft industry-shaping digital experiences. You will lead the charge in creating intuitive, high-quality interfaces that drive business success while delivering exceptional user experiences. Collaboration, curiosity, and adaptability define our approach, and we're looking for someone who thrives in a dynamic, creative environment.


**What you'll do**  

Provide strategic direction, concepts, and UX/UI design for digital applications, mixed reality, and physical-digital experiences.  

Create prototypes, iterate, and fine-tune details in close collaboration with fellow designers.  

Design and facilitate workshops with users, clients, and colleagues.  

Lead the strategy-design process—from pitching and scoping to insights, execution, and final delivery.  

Continuously explore and re-invent ways of working, sharing inspiration and knowledge with the team.


**Who you are**

  

* A problem-solver who turns complex design challenges into elegant solutions.
* Highly skilled in UX/UI design, with a strong portfolio to back it up.
* Fluent in industry-standard design tools and always curious about what's next.
* Experienced—at least five years in a fast-paced, collaborative design environment.
* Bonus points if you have motion design skills (After Effects, Principle, or similar tools).
* Mindset and personality can beat the amount of years that you have been working. But for this role we thing that +6 years of experience would be a good baseline.
* A strong communicator in English, both written and spoken.


**Why join Manyone?**


* A truly global work environment with opportunities to collaborate across teams and cultures.
* A supportive and inspiring team that values innovation, adaptability, and creativity.
* Continuous learning and development opportunities to push your skills further.Let's build the future together.


**Help us shape everything that's next.**


Every day, from our 14 locations in 10 countries, our more than 300 strategists, designers, and technologists help businesses grow by providing a clear vision, creative problem-solving, and concrete results. Across industries and markets, there are endless possibilities to make bold change happen, and we want to be our clients' business partner of choice.


**Interested in LGBTQIA+ representation at Manyone?**


'Pride at Manyone' is our very own LGBTQIA+ network and takes every opportunity to ensure LGBTQIA+ applicants get insights into Manyone's safe space culture and feel comfortable about being out when applying for a job and when working at Manyone. Thinking about joining Manyone and would like to know more? Read more at manyone.com/careers (https://manyone.com/careers).

title: UX/UI Designer  Intern

description:
