title: Sjuksköterska måndag till fredag till smärtrehabiliteringsavdelning!
description:
VO Geriatrik, Rehabilitering och Smärtcentrum består av flera olika sektioner. Samtliga sektioner kännetecknas av välfungerande interprofessionellt samarbete, något vi är mycket stolta över. Vi vill att du ska känna dig välkommen till oss, som ny erbjuds du handledning, introduktion och yrkesnätverk.  

  

Inom Smärtcentrum är vi experter på rehabilitering och smärta men strävar alltid efter att bli ännu bättre. Som en del i detta ligger ett stort fokus på forskning och framsteg, både inom och utanför sjukhuset. Som medarbetare är du en viktig del i detta, det är naturligt för dig att vilja utvecklas och driva verksamheten framåt.  

  

Vi söker nu dig som är intresserad av att arbeta på vår trevliga smärtrehabiliteringsavdelning. Avdelningen har max 8 patienter i veckan och du kommer att arbeta tillsammans med ett erfaret och professionellt team. Du kommer att få handledning och fördjupad undervisning om specialområdet smärta under introduktionstiden. Vi strävar efter att ha en hög nivå och fortbildning erbjuds löpande.  

  

Som sjuksköterska är du en självklar teammedlem där övriga professioner är läkare, psykolog, kurator, arbetsterapeut och fysioterapeut. På Smärtrehabiliteringen finns en sjuksköterskegrupp om 3 personer, varav två arbetar på avdelningen och en på vår mottagning. Du blir en viktig person i teamarbetet där man stöttar och hjälper varandra samtidigt som du kommer att arbeta självständigt.  

På avdelningen arbetar också fyra duktiga undersköterskor varav en enbart arbetar natt.  

  

Smärtrehabiliteringsavdelningen ligger ute på Specialistrehabiliteringsenheten vid Ultuna, Genetikvägen 4.  

  

**Ditt uppdrag**  

Att vara sjuksköterska på smärtrehabiliteringsavdelningen är ett spännande och roligt jobb! Det innebär att du får möta många komplexa patienter.  

  

Det finns goda möjligheter att få en god kontakt med både team och patienter. Du är delaktig i planeringen av patientens rehabilitering, undervisar i grupp/individuellt samt utför terapeutiskt arbete och har ansvar för arbetet med levnadsvanor. Du är aktiv i utvecklingsarbetet på avdelningen. Vi arbetar utifrån en helhetssyn på våra patienter och psykologiskt/psykiatriskt perspektiv är en del i vårt arbete. Vi har ett genomgående beteendeinriktat, kognitivt förhållningssätt.  

  

Eftersom Akademiska sjukhuset är ett universitetssjukhus med uppdrag att bedriva sjukvård och forskning får du också möjligheten att vara med och utveckla vården för våra patienter.  

  

**Dina kvalifikationer**  

Vi söker dig som är legitimerad sjuksköterska med några års erfarenhet av sjuksköterskeyrket. Det är meriterande om du har vidareutbildning av KBT steg 1 och mycket meriterande om du har arbetat med smärtrehabilitering/smärta eller om du har erfarenhet från psykiatri/beroende/onkologi. Erfarenhet från motiverande samtal är också meriterande. Du arbetar alltid med patientens bästa i fokus och är ansvarstagande i ditt arbete och du blir en viktig person för patienterna i deras rehabiliteringsprocess. Arbetet innebär även en del administrativa arbetsuppgifter så du bör ha god organisationsförmåga och gilla ordning och reda. Du är också en positiv kollega som vill bidra till en god arbetsmiljö.  

  

**Din kompetens**  

Initiativtagande - Du tar initiativ och sätter igång aktiviteter som ger resultat.  

Självgående - Du tar ansvar för din uppgift och driver dina processer vidare på ett strukturerat sätt.  

Flexibel - Du har lätt för att anpassa dig till ändrade omständigheter och ser möjligheter i förändringar.  

Samarbetsförmåga - Du arbetar bra med andra människor, är lyhörd och löser konflikter på ett konstruktivt sätt.  

  

**Vi erbjuder**  

Vikariat under en föräldraledighet från 2025-05-15 till 2026-08-31. Arbetstiden är måndag till fredag, dagtid. Tillträde efter överenskommelse. Hos oss får du förmåner som gör skillnad, läs om förmånerna här.  

  

**Vill du veta mer?**  

Avdelningschef Karin Cloud Mildton 018- 617 3726  

Bitr avdelningschef Sara Marklund 018- 611 4389  

Facklig kontaktperson, Vårdförbundet nås via växeln 018-611 00 00  

  

**Vill du jobba med oss?**  

Välkommen med din ansökan via länken nedan. Urval och tillsättning kan komma att ske fortlöpande under ansökningstiden.  

  

*Region Uppsala värdesätter de kvaliteter som jämn könsfördelning och mångfald tillför verksamheten. Vi ser därför gärna sökande av alla kön och med olika födelsebakgrund, funktionalitet och livserfarenhet.*  

  

*Region Uppsala krigsplacerar all tillsvidareanställd personal utifrån totalförsvarets behov. Detta innebär för den enskilda medarbetaren inga förpliktelser i fredstid utan är enkom en planeringsåtgärd.*  

  

*Kontroll mot misstanke- och belastningsregister kommer att göras avseende alla personer som arbetsgivaren har för avsikt att anställa eller anlita för patientnära arbete utifrån att de kan komma att arbeta inom psykiatrisk sjukvård, habilitering, vård av barn och ungdom eller tvångsvård av missbrukare, områden som omfattas av fakultativa registerutdrag. Detta gäller således alla som kommer att arbeta patientnära även om arbetsuppgifterna i nuläget inte är tänkta att huvudsakligen innehålla arbete med ovan nämnda patientgrupper.*

title: Head of Investor Relations
description:
Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 175,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch’s Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
  
Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
  
At Sinch we “Dream Big”, “Win Together”, “Keep it simple”, and “Make it Happen”. These values are our foundation!
  
  

About the role
  
Founded in 2008 and stock-listed in 2015, Sinch has grown rapidly to become one of the world’s leading providers of Digital customer communications. The company has been profitable and cash generative since its foundation and has an explicit strategy to grow both organically and through acquisitions. The business is present across the Americas, EMEA and APAC and has completed 16 acquisitions since the IPO in 2015.
  
As Head of Investor Relations, you are responsible for the Sinch’s communication with the financial markets and interaction with the financial community. You collaborate with multiple stakeholders inside Sinch and work closely with Sinch’s CEO and CFO to ensure that the company’s differentiation and ability to create shareholder value is well-appreciated by analysts, investors and other key stakeholders.
  
  

**Key responsibilities:**  

* Clear and concise articulation of Sinch’s overall equity story and subject-specific communications around specific industry themes and topics with financial analysts, investors and prospective investors.
* Ensuring that Sinch’s communications are handled in full compliance with regulatory requirements such as the EU Market Abuse Regulation (MAR), Nasdaq Listing Rules, and Swedish Code of Corporate Governance.
* Supporting Sinch’s management and board of directors in their interaction with the financial community.
* Production of quarterly and annual reports, presentation materials and related collaterals (together with colleagues in Sinch’s finance organization and relevant third-party vendors).
* Management of regulatory press release distribution.
* Responsibility for IR-related tools and Sinch’s external Investor Relations website.


The role is based at Sinch’s headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden. You will report to Sinch's Group CFO.
  
  

**Requirements:**  

To be successful in this role we believe that you have led the Investor Relations function or worked in the Investor Relations team of a listed company. Alternatively, you may have worked as a financial analyst or as an IR consultant.
  
  

**We are looking for:**  

* Extensive experience with financial analysis, writing reports and creating presentation materials.
* Experience from businesses working in technology, software or telecommunications.
* Strong networking and communication skills, where you appreciate regular interaction with internal and external stakeholders.
* Strong organizational skills, and attention to detail that result in high-quality work.
* Excellent presentation skills.
* Fluent verbal and written Swedish and English.


Our hiring process
  
We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
  
We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!
company_description: We help companies to communicate with customers via messaging, voice and video using multiple channels. Simplifying life by bringing all people and businesses together using technology is our purpose.

title: Söker QA engineer i Stockholm
description:
About the role
  
We are looking for an experienced QA Engineer to join our growing team. You will be working directly with our customers in various teams and with different products. It is a great opportunity for a long term cooperation. We offer flexible working hours and a hybrid model. You will work in a senior team with driven colleagues.
  
At this role you will focus on designing and developing automated test cases in a close collaboration with software developers and designers. Among your responsibilities will be also increasing quality through regression testing as well as identification and documentation of bugs.
  
About Provide IT
  
Provide IT has offices in Gothenburg and Stockholm. We have two business areas, consulting and a digital agency. In consulting, our employees have a great opportunity to work with exciting clients. During these projects they learn a lot by working in diverse teams. At the agency, we primarily develop customized websites, systems and applications for our customers. We offer attractive salary and benefits. Provide IT has a great company culture that is key for our employees. We also do a lot of team building activities. Join us and see for yourself!
  
Requirements
  
Good experience in testing and handling different test cases (e.g. Junit, Feature, Regression, Acceptance, Performance, Load, Security tests)
  
Strong expertise in different test frameworks
  
Experience in test automation (e.g. with Selenium or equivalent frameworks)
  
Worked in agile environments
  
Fluent Swedish preferred
  
Degree in Computer Science or equivalent
  
Nice to have
  
Knowledge of cloud environments (e.g. Azure, AWS, GCP)
  
  

Send your application with a CV to info@provideit.se. Hope to hear from you!

title: Product Manager to DeLaval
description:
Are you passionate about digital transformation in the agricultural sector? Do you want to help dairy farmers optimize their operations through data-driven solutions? DeLaval is looking for a Product Manager - Digital Services to drive innovation and enhance the customer experience on our DeLaval Plus platform. This is an opportunity you cant miss! Location: This position is open to candidates based in any country within European time zones, provided they have strong travel connections.
  
Hybrid (2-3 days/week in the office)
  
**Start date:** Asap
  
  

About DeLaval DeLaval is a world leader in the dairy industry with a clear vision of enabling sustainable food production. A strong focus on customer, product, and employee is essential to realizing the vision of being at the forefront of digitization. DeLavals vision is to make sustainable food production possible. They support their customers in reducing their environmental footprint while improving food production, profitability and the well-being of the people and animals involved.
  
About the job As a Product Manager – Digital Services at DeLaval, you will play a key role in supporting customer growth and increasing active use of DeLaval Plus by creating real value for our users. You will be responsible for managing the product lifecycle of digital applications and services, driving new product development, and collaborating with sales territories, Commercial Offering, and other key stakeholders.
  
This role focuses on leveraging animal data from DeLaval farms to monitor and analyze herd and individual animal performance. By providing farmers and advisors with actionable insights, you will help them execute daily, weekly, and monthly tasks more effectively—enabling them to reach their performance goals, identify risks, and take timely corrective actions.
  
Key responsibilities
  
Drive the Digital Services roadmap in line with company strategy.
  
Align with Commercial Offering on go-to-market, release plans, training, and communication.
  
Develop digital services and DeLaval Plus based on market insights and user feedback.
  
Conduct product discovery per our Operating Model.
  
Define and track key success metrics.
  
Shape product strategy with internal and external partners.
  
Ensure Service Level Objectives are met.
  
Manage a 1–3 year agile roadmap with Area Product Managers.
  
Oversee dependencies, priorities, demos, and presentations.
  
Lead release planning, communication, and training.
  
Gather insights from users, customers, and dealers.
  
Collaborate on prototypes with design and product teams.
  
Secure senior management and stakeholder buy-in.
  
  

About you We are looking for a curious, humble, and collaborative professional with a passion for digital services and agriculture. The ideal candidate should have experience from:
  
Agricultural Expertise
  
A university degree in Agriculture, Livestock Production, or a related field.
  
Solid experience in dairy farm management, whether from working on farms, as an advisor, a veterinarian, or in another relevant role.
  
Strong understanding of daily farm operations, animal health, and herd performance, allowing you to communicate effectively with farmers and advisors.
  
  

Strategic Thinker & Product Leader
  
Ability to develop and execute a clear product vision, including strategy, roadmap planning, and defining key performance indicators (KPIs).
  
Experience in managing the full product lifecycle, from concept to market launch and continuous improvements.
  
A holistic approach to product development, ensuring that digital solutions align with the needs of end users and business objectives.
  
  

Strong Communicator & Collaborator
  
Experience working across different teams, bringing together internal and external stakeholders to align on a common mission.
  
Ability to simplify complex ideas and translate business goals into clear product requirements.
  
Excellent presentation and interpersonal skills to engage with colleagues, customers, and external partners.
  
Fluent in English. Additional language skills are a plus
  
  

Leadership & Team Player
  
Strong leadership skills with a deep belief in fostering a culture of collaboration, transparency, safety, and trust.
  
A team player who breaks down silos, encourages knowledge sharing, and supports colleagues in achieving common goals.
  
A problem-solver who thrives in fast-paced, evolving environments and is comfortable making data-driven decisions.
  
  

Digital Transformation & Technology Mindset
  
Previous experience in digital transformations, cloud technologies, or business change initiatives.
  
Knowledge of Agile product development, preferably within large organizations or fast-moving industries.
  
Strong interest in emerging technology trends and their application in dairy farming and agricultural solutions.
  
  

Analytical & Problem-Solving Skills
  
Ability to analyze data, identify trends, and translate insights into actionable strategies.
  
A structured approach to problem-solving, ensuring that digital solutions are both user-friendly and scalable.
  
Passion for continuous learning and improvement, with a mindset that embraces change and innovation.
  
  

Its a bonus if you have experience in developing and delivering digital services for global dairy farmers, service technicians, or dealers.
  
Welcome with your application This recruitment will be conducted by Ed: Za Group. If you have any questions or concerns related to the position or the process, feel free to contact charlotte.hoffstrom@edzagroup.se

title: Information Security Specialist
description:
At Toyota Material Handling Europe, we create the technology that keeps the world moving. Diverse businesses across Europe depend on our logistics and material handling solutions. By pioneering technology like automation, connectivity and productivity solutions, we enable our customers' logistics operations to be as efficient as possible.
  
We firmly believe in setting ideas in motion. At Toyota Material Handling Europe, we are over 13,500 colleagues passionate about supporting companies of all sizes with todays and tomorrow's material handling challenges. Because we know that our business and our industry are essential and sometimes even critical for them, for daily life and society at large.
  
In our respective headquarters in Mjölby, Sweden, Willebroek, Belgium, in our Sales companies across Europe, or in our factories in France, Italy and Sweden, you can be part of an extraordinary journey. And together, we will Move the world towards easy and sustainable.
  
  

The Position
  
We are strengthening our Information Security team at our headquarters in Mjölby. As an Information Security Specialist, you will be part of our increasing efforts improving the information security and risk management within Toyota Material Handling Europe (TMHE).
  
  

Your Responsibilities
  
As part of our information security team, you will contribute to building and maintaining a secure foundation for our organization. Together, we:
  
**Drive strategic development:** Shape strategies, principles, and policies to address current and future risks in TMHE's evolving IT-landscape.
  
**Ensure compliance and fulfilment:** Manage compliance efforts and requirement fulfilment for entities and operational objects. Provide risk assessments and expert advisory support.
  
**Translate policies into action:** Convert information security policies and frameworks into effective technical controls. Establish secure reporting mechanisms and relevant metrics.
  
**Collaborate across functions:** Partner with key departments such as procurement and legal to align security efforts with broader organizational goals.
  
**Promote risk awareness:** Lead risk coordination efforts in IS/IT, improve processes, and increase awareness organization-wide.
  
**Raise security awareness:** Develop and deliver educational initiatives that build understanding and encourage a culture of security.
  
**Contribute as an expert:** Depending on your expertise, take the lead in information security projects, act as Information security expert in IS/IT projects, implement classification frameworks, perform risk analyses, provide security training, and/or review changes to ensure compliance and secure implementation.
  
  

Your Profile
  
We are looking for an experienced, self-driven information security professional with the following qualifications and traits:
  
**Broad Expertise:** You have knowledge and experience in various information security areas, such as risk management, information classification, assurance activities, and establishing security policies.
  
Education within relevant area and/or experience in information and IT security, with a strong interest in driving security initiatives.
  
**Framework Proficiency:** Skilled in security practices grounded in established methods, legislation, and frameworks. Comfortable collaborating with legal, audit, and compliance teams.
  
**Technical Acumen:** Experienced in security work within hybrid and cloud environments, particularly in large organizations.
  
**Professional Credentials:** Certifications such as CISM, CISSP, or equivalents are an advantage.
  
**Inspirational Leadership:** Passionate about guiding and promoting security awareness, serving as an ambassador within your field of expertise.
  
**Cultural Fit:** Aligned with our values of teamwork, respect, and challenge, and committed to enhancing our security posture.
  
**Adaptability and Confidence:** Comfortable acting as both an expert advisor and a leader in various security-related initiatives.
  
**Communication Skills:** Fluent in spoken and written English, able to communicate complex topics effectively.
  
  

Our Offer
  
In a rapidly evolving high-tech industry, Toyota Material Handling Europe stands as a stable, global, and influential player. We offer a dynamic, diverse, and welcoming local work environment, always within an international context. The position is within our IS/IT department, at our European Headquarters in Mjölby Sweden, along with the flexibility to work remotely two days a week.
  
We offer an attractive benefits package, including a yearly bonus and prioritise a healthy work-life balance through flexible arrangements. Our culture fosters continuous learning and collaboration, ensuring you can grow both personally and professionally. You will have the chance to engage in challenging and impactful projects that shape the future of our industry, while our inclusive environment ensures that every voice is heard and valued.
  
  

Time for you to make a MOVE!
  
  

Your Application
  
Send your application, CV, and cover letter in English no later than March 30th, 2025. We screen continuously, so don't miss out, send in your application today!
  
**For more information please contact:** Lotta Frisell, Head of Enterprise Architecture: Lotta.Frisell@toyota-industries.eu
  
For more information regarding the recruitment process, please contact: Patrik Schultzén, Talent Acquisition Specialist, Patrik.schultzen@toyota-industries.eu
  
Let's explore the possibilities together!
  
#EUROPE

title: Sr. Sales Engineer
description:
The Sr. Sales Engineer provides pre-sales technical support for all Tungsten Automation products and associated applications. While assigned to a geographic area, Sr. Sales Engineers also collaborate with and backup peers from across the country to provide efficient pre-sales support nationwide.



The Sr. Sales Engineer is responsible for:


* Preparing standard and custom demonstrations for Tungsten Automation Account Managers and resellers
* The handling of all pre-sales technical issues professionally and efficiently
* Maintaining in-depth knowledge of Tungsten Automation products
* Maintaining a working knowledge of content repositories
* Maintaining a working knowledge of workflow systems
* Ensuring an understanding of key verticals which may include Financial Services, Insurance, Manufacturing, Logistics, Healthcare among others
* Understanding Tungsten Automation's role in supporting business processes, including process assessments, solution development as well as current and future requirements.
* Responding to technical questions in RFI/P/Qs
* Sharing “Best Practices” with other SEs
* Creating and distributing reusable assets for the greater Tungsten Automation community (SEs, AEs, Partners, Marketing etc.). These may include demonstrations, presentations, training materials, whitepapers etc. that speak to thought leadership
* Providing feedback to Product Development regarding new features, improving product performance, and eliminating bugs in the product
* Preparing Tungsten Automation Professional Services for efficient installations – professionally managing the transition from pre-sales to post-sales and staying appropriately involved as the implementation progresses
* Preparing resellers on the technical aspects of selling Tungsten Automation solutions practices and procedures
* Serving as a point of contact for resellers on technical issues
* Responding to resellers requests for pre-sale technical support

  

  

  

Required Skills  

Performance is measured by the revenue produced in Tungsten Automation software sales, professional services, and other measurable performance such as: demonstrations, overall sales support, communications, team building, Internal asset contribution and technical leadership. Measurable performance also includes the individuals willingness to:


* Seek and successfully completes special assignments that enable continued development of his/her technical and/or other job-related skills and abilities
* Regularly go out of his/her way to assist others in the team or department
* Demonstrate openness to feedback and constructive criticism
* Through openness and a flexible style of working with others, help to foster an environment of innovation and creativity
* Assist in maintaining a professional customer environment with positive customer satisfaction
* Make a concerted effort to stay abreast of technological advances and Tungsten Automation's industry overall


All Tungsten Automation Sr. Sales Engineers regardless of title or level must possess the following skills and knowledge:


* Communications/Listening Skills


(Internal & external) – including but not limited to professional writing, problem escalation, and good analysis skills as outlined below.


* Analysis/Discovery (ROI) -


Ability to plan for and conduct an Interview with the prospect and/or customer to determine the true business requirements to help build a valid Return on Investment (ROI).


* Project Management


Critical path analysis to do risk assessment, problem decomposition and resource estimation. Not a concentrated focus on the tools available to manage projects but a working knowledge of the concepts and how they apply in sales situations i.e. knowledge of the theory, not the mechanics.


* Sales & Presentation Skills


Professional presentation skills and experience in team selling, solution selling methodologies, and an understanding of and ability to utilize the Tungsten Automation Sales Process


* Time Management


Ability to manage projects including preparation for presentations and demonstrations, training, scheduling, and reporting, and expense processing. This is critical to the success of the sales opportunities as the Sr. Sales Engineer will be required to manage multiple sales campaigns at any given time.


* **Industry/General Technology Knowledge**


A ***high level understanding*** of basic networking and operating system concepts, Visual Basic development / scripting – Ability to develop, test and deploy custom VB/VBA scripts, Java and JavaScript, Industry specific business pain points with active paper processing, storage, and retrieval, and an understanding of J2EE, XML, .NET, OCR, ICR and their use in business processing.


* Tungsten Automation Technology Knowledge


A ***high level understanding*** of each of the suites that constitute the Tungsten Automation product line and the ability to fit the pieces together into the whole strategy - By stating the requirement for ‘a ***high level understanding***’, it is defined as the ability to:


* Position the Tungsten Automation Solution
* Understand the components that make each the solution and why
* Define target markets
* Explain the business value/value proposition
* Describe sample use cases
* Describe reference customers
* Position and differentiate each solution from the other Tungsten Automation technologies
* Identify and Qualify potential opportunities
* Understand the applicability of the technology i.e. where the solution is a good fit and where it is a bad fit
* Deliver high-level presentation and associated conceptual demonstration
* Understanding of the underlying technology concepts.
* Differentiate new product from current product
* General Architecture – understanding of how all of the components fit together technically as well as how they integrate and work with external technologies. This includes an understanding of:
* Foundation technologies including but not limited to XML, IIS, .NET, OCR, ICR, Web Services, Cloud, AI & Machine Learning
* Tungsten Automation Networking Constraints
* Tungsten Automation Components and Services, with a particular focus on Invoice Automation (purchase to pay, e-Invoicing, accounts payable automation).

  

  

  

Required Experience  

The qualified applicant must demonstrate knowledge of the roles, responsibilities, processes, tools and techniques used by pre-sales technical support and sales departments, and have excellent people skills, communication and negotiation skills along with the ability to perform professional presentations, and extensive, up-to-date technical knowledge in document management and digital processing.



Qualifications include:


* 7-10 years’ experience supporting a solution sales team in the pre-sales technical role
* Experience leading complex, technical, enterprise solution-based opportunities through the opportunity sales step to successful close
* Bachelor’s degree in information systems, computer science, information technology or a related discipline, or equivalent years of experience.
* Professional presentation experience
* Publishing of white papers, blogs, thought leadership assets
* Business analysis at both the IT and LOB level, including the ability to document the analysis in a useable, shareable format
* Experience working with various partners/channel organization
* Ability to travel 50%
* Knowledge and experience with e-Invoicing and/or accounts payable automation solutions
* Experience in business process management/software industry is a plus.
* A Fundamentals Level of understanding around Cloud, Cloud Services, AI, Machine Learning, and deploying Enterprise Software on the Cloud is highly desirable.

  


***Tungsten Automation is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Vets***
company_description: Tungsten Automation is a leading supplier of software and solutions to automate and digitally transform human and information intensive processes across front and back office operations.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**"We value your ideas and curiosity since they are key enablers to keep up with the ever-changing machine learning field." - Therese, Head of Machine Learning.**


Sellpy’s vision is to empower everyone to live circularly. We see a tremendous financial, social and environmental value in making sure unused items are put to use again. We are looking for colleagues who share this vision, and who are ready to see their work contribute to a sustainable future.


**Machine Learning at Sellpy**


We look for you who want to be part of our journey to make sustainable shopping the first-hand choice by building great product recommendations, using computer vision to make the item handling process smoother and other user-friendly solutions. We want to provide the best customer experience and that’s why we need you on board.


This job will suit you if you’re excited to build solutions leveraging the latest machine learning models and build custom models to solve unique challenges together with a team of highly motivated engineers.

**In short, you will**


* Build machine learning models with a major impact on our product
* Simplify, build and improve our already existing models
* Build solutions leveraging the latest machine learning development
* Enjoy personal growth during our level-up days once a month
* Keep up with ML development with the team on weekly deep dives
* Make use of your skills in Tensorflow and Python


**Requirements**


* B.S or M.S. degree in Computer Science or related field
* Strong proficiency in Python
* Experience with ML frameworks such as Tensorflow or PyTorch
* Experience with AWS or similar cloud service providers
* Written and spoken fluency in English

**We’d be impressed if you have**


* Previous experience with recommender systems
* Knowledge about how to build efficient data pipelines
* Experience in setting up ML systems in production
* Knowledge of relational databases and SQL

**You’ll get to**


* Be part of a tech-minded company that's driving the change towards a sustainable lifestyle. In return, you will get direction, energy, and work on meaningful challenges on a daily basis.
* Benefit from hybrid work from our offices at Medborgarplatsen, and from home.
* Work with highly skilled and motivated colleagues.
* Gain new skills with unlimited access to a learning platform
* Spend time on personal development during monthly level-up days.
* Enjoy Sellpy credits and staff discounts at Sellpy and the H&M brands (Arket, COS, Other Stories, Weekday and more).
* Save up with a monthly pension plan.
* Engagement in Sellpy’s social traditions with game nights, interactive planning days, guest speakers and other activities.

**Location**


You are welcome to do all these things at our office at Medborgarplatsen in Stockholm, and from home.


**Form of employment:** Full-time

**Start:** As agreed upon
company_description: Put your talent to better use.

title: Business Area Manager, Financing - Pagero
description:
**Business Area Manager Financing – Pagero**


Are you ready to lead and innovate in the world of financing applications?


Pagero is seeking a dynamic leader to join our team as the Business Area Manager for Financing Applications. This role is pivotal in driving revenue growth through strategic initiatives and innovative product development, as well as supporting commercial teams in customer and partner engagements.


Pagero has recently joined Thomson Reuters. Together, we are building the world’s largest, open business network. With our cloud-based network, customers can reach any business, anywhere in the world – no matter how many borders their operations may cross. We take care of the technical and regulatory requirements across the entire order-to-cash, purchase-to-pay and freight processes, to give customers data accuracy and security, transparency, and real-time visibility. All this through a single connection.

**About the Role**


In this opportunity as Business Area Manager Financing, you will:

* Develop Business Strategies: Lead the creation and execution of comprehensive business strategies to achieve Pagero’s goals within financing applications.
* Drive Revenue Growth: Innovate product development, optimize pricing, and devise sales strategies to boost revenue.
* Support Commercial Teams: Collaborate with commercial teams to enhance customer and partner engagements.
* Collaborate Across Departments: Work closely with product marketing, strategy, planning & analysis, and other departments to ensure alignment and achieve goals.
* Conduct Market Analysis: Stay updated on industry trends, competitive landscape, and emerging technologies to identify opportunities and threats.
* Communicate with Stakeholders: Clearly communicate strategy and progress to executive leadership and other stakeholders.

**About You**


You’re a fit for the role of Business Area Manager Financing if you have the following required qualifications:

* At least 5 years' experience within factoring or supply chain financing solutions.
* Proven experience in business strategy development and implementation.
* Strong background in product development and revenue generation.
* Experience in customer-facing roles, demonstrating strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills.
* Excellent analytical skills to monitor market trends and competitive landscape.
* Effective communication skills for stakeholder engagement.
* Successfully pass an extended background check.


#LI-EH2

**What’s in it For You?**


Join us to inform the way forward with the latest AI solutions and address real-world challenges in legal, tax, compliance, and news. Backed by our commitment to continuous learning and market-leading benefits, you’ll be prepared to grow, lead, and thrive in an AI-enabled future. This includes:

* **Industry-Leading Benefits:** We offer comprehensive benefit plans to include flexible vacation, two company-wide Mental Health Days off, access to the Headspace app, retirement savings, tuition reimbursement, employee incentive programs, and resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
* **Flexibility & Work-Life Balance:** Flex My Way is a set of supportive workplace policies designed to help manage personal and professional responsibilities, whether caring for family, giving back to the community, or finding time to refresh and reset. This builds upon our flexible work arrangements, including work from anywhere for up to 8 weeks per year, and hybrid model, empowering employees to achieve a better work-life balance.
* **Career Development and Growth:** By fostering a culture of continuous learning and skill development, we prepare our talent to tackle tomorrow’s challenges and deliver real-world solutions. Our skills-first approach ensures you have the tools and knowledge to grow, lead, and thrive in an AI-enabled future.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for inclusion, innovation, and customer-focus. Our eleven business resource groups nurture our culture of belonging across the diverse backgrounds and experiences represented across our global footprint.
* **Hybrid Work Model:** We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment (2-3 days a week in the office depending on the role) for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected.
* **Social Impact:** Make an impact in your community with our Social Impact Institute. We offer employees two paid volunteer days off annually and opportunities to get involved with pro-bono consulting projects and Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives.
  

Roles that are provided access to restricted or sensitive information that may be misused or may cause harm to individuals or organizations will, upon hiring, be subjected to an extended background check. These roles include individuals working within Pagero Online with support or admin rights and having access to Pagero customer’s data, employees working within finance, or similar functions.

**About Thomson Reuters**


Thomson Reuters clarifies today’s complex landscape with AI and technology, deep subject-matter expertise, and content the world has trusted for over 150 years – giving professionals the confidence to know today, navigate tomorrow, and lead a fast-evolving world. Our industry-leading products include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting, and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services, Reuters.


We empower our colleagues to reduce inefficiencies so they can do more of the work that matters, act decisively to add greater value for critical stakeholders, and anticipate future challenges to face the unexpected. As the future arrives faster than ever, we’re standing alongside our global team of more than 26,000 teammates across 70+ countries, ready to fulfill our purpose: to inform the way forward. Sound exciting? Apply today to join our team!

**Equal Opportunity & Accessibility**


As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.  

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law. Additional details on how to request an accommodation can be found here.

**Protect yourself from fraudulent job postings –** click here **to learn more.**


More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on https://thomsonreuters.com.

title: Strategic Sourcing Manager
description:
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.
Senior Sourcing manager, SW and IT - Tietoevry (m/f/d)
About the job
Do you have a strong background in Sourcing of Cloud and Infrastructure SW and/or HW, a passion for problem-solving, and want to join one of the largest tech companies in the Nordics? Then this is the role for you!  

  

We are further strengthening our Continuous Services Strategic Sourcing team and are now looking for a senior sourcing manager to join our team. To excel in this role, you need to have extensive experience on strategic sourcing and supplier management, executing sourcing initiatives and have structured, highly collaborative & impact driven working approach.  

  

Key responsibilities:* Actively seeking new opportunities for sourcing initiative pipeline and executing strategic sourcing initiatives, focus on software licenses agreements
* Takes the lead in planning and executing strategic sourcing initiatives, cultivating strong collaboration with Stakeholders
* Sourcing business partner for designated business stakeholders
* Developing category plans to capture short- and long-term business opportunities with financial impact and plan execution of sourcing initiatives
* Proactively lead, plan and drive negotiations, particularly for larger, complex sourcing initiatives
* Managing and securing up-to-date supplier contracts
* Supplier management for designated suppliers. Drive and develop strategic supplier relationship in collaboration with stakeholders
* Provide direction to buyers on suppliers and contracts, to ensure compliance, quality, and efficiency in the purchase-to-pay process.
* Constantly seeking for opportunities to simplify and work in more efficient way
* Contributing to overall team performance as active member of the sourcing team


.
We operate as one, integrated Sourcing function. You will be member of Continuous Services Strategic Sourcing team and report to Monica Derksen.  

  

Personality & working style:  

  

You are an engaging and business minded sourcing professional with extensive experience of strategic sourcing and a proven track record of negotiating significant sourcing initiatives and supplier management to ensure execution of the negotiated deal:* Doer who has bias for action & delivering impact – highly structured way-of-working, impact-oriented approach and independent (self-starter) working style
* Influencing and presenting skills – you have ability to communicate effectively both with executives and specialists and genuine desire & ability to deliver business impact to the company
* Highly analytical & fact-based – you can both see the big picture, identify long term trends and to drill down to drivers when needed. You use data to drive real business benefits and bring speed to decision making and execution
* Result oriented project manager - Being able to identify new opportunities to create impact, prioritize the work and secure successful implementation of these initiatives
* Highly skilled in negotiation, indirect influencing and selling ideas in complex matrix organizations.
* Team player who can contribute to teamwork, also in areas outside of own direct responsibilities

  

Experience & education:* 10+ years of strategic sourcing experience with a proven track record of negotiating significant sourcing initiatives and managing global suppliers
* Experience in working with global software and/or hardware suppliers is preferred
* Experience in software licensing from infrastructure, security and compliance, and cloud based -solutions business models is preferred
* Proven negotiation skills
* Experience in building and managing strategic supplier relationship to maximize value
* Experience of managing spend and using TCO (total cost of ownership) to minimize waste
* Experience from working in international organization with complex business models and matrix organization
* M.Sc. from relevant field
* Fully proficient written and verbal English communication skills


Location options: Solna, Espoo  

  

Did we get you inspired?  

  

We look forward to your application!  

  

Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we will reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Monica Derksen, monica.derksen@tietoevry.com  

  

Hope to hear from you soon!  

At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: BIM Specialist
description:
**Description**  



  

**The opportunity**

  

As a BIM Specialist, you will assess architectural, structural, and mechanical design models. You will check the quality and accuracy of the models, extract quantities, identify and resolve clashes, analyze costs, and develop documentation and representations. You will also be required to construct and maintain 3D/4D/5D/6D Building Information Models on occasion.


Because this is a global position, you will be working with colleagues, clients, suppliers, and subcontractors from all over the world. It is critical that you work well as part of a team and understand how to communicate effectively and clearly. BIM is still a developing matter, and it is critical to maintain an instructional approach to ensure that everyone is on the same page.

**How you'll make an impact**

* Lead project BIM and Model Coordination meetings: spatial coordination of disciplines, gathering all discipline BIM models including civil and performing coordination tasks
* Conduct 3D BIM design reviews, clash-detection and conflict resolution
* Manage and assist in the coordination efforts of all parties involved in the project including owners, architects/engineers, consultants, sub-contractors
* Derive BIM modeling requirements and guidelines from contract requirements and for BIM use throughout the lifecycle
* Support project team by managing and creating content library files and templates, creating and enforcing standards and evaluating project models.
* Act as the main point of contact for BIM technology and any related issues between the construction managers, subcontractors, owners, design team, and others as required
* Aid in the preparation and revisions of project budgets, estimates, and construction schedules
* Liaison with clients and other consultants regarding BIM standards/processes, and document project BIM standards/processes for distribution to the project team.

**Your background**

* You have a strong mindset and are able to lead large scale coordination meetings
* Good knowledge of BIM related platforms such as BIM360/Autodesk Construction Cloud and thorough understanding of BIM processes and global BIM standards
* Minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree within a related field
* Experience in 3D Modeling in the relevant tools and experience from BIM, Model and Data coordination.
* Preferably experience from Revit Architecture, Revit MEP, Autocad and Autocad MEP and Navisworks
* Fluency in English and strong analytical skills, excellent writing, and communication skills with experience of C-level business discussions

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More about us**


In this role, you can work from either Ludvika or Västerås in Sweden, and we also provide flexible work-from-home possibilities.


We want to hear from you if you are passionate about BIM and the energy sector and are searching for a challenging and rewarding career, so we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet all of the requirements.

  

Recruiting Manager Rohit Dahiya, rohit.dahiya@hitachienergy.com will be happy to answer your questions regarding this position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 29 86; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85. All other questions should be directed to Talent Partner Nicole Bergman, nicole.bergman@hitachienergy.com.

**Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Hitachi Energy career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**This is solely for job seekers with disabilities requiring accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Messages left for other purposes will not receive a response.**
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

title: Summer Intern in Vulnerability Research
description:
**Are you a dedicated and driven student with a desire to learn? Do you want to put your cybersecurity curiosity and fundamentals to good use and gain professional experience in a fast-moving, dynamic team? Then this might be the perfect opportunity for you!**

**Our Vulnerability Research team is looking for students to work with us!**


This is an opportunity to be part of a dynamic, international team of cybersecurity experts who enjoy having fun at work while developing and researching digital vulnerabilities – both new and old.


At Outpost24, we envision solutions that identify risks that could disrupt our customers’ business before it happens. These solutions are flexible to any process or technology our customers' businesses use. Our teams build these solutions in our beautiful office in Karlskrona, Sweden where the passion and expertise within IT Security is shown through our everyday work.


If your study area and interests are in Vulnerability Research, Software and Platform Identification, Test Automation in virtual lab environments, or Cloud Infrastructure Security, don’t hesitate to send in your application.


Some of the technologies and tools we use in our field of work, and are looking for proficiency with include:

* Python scripting for automated vulnerability assessments, integration test suites, and web data scraping and processing
* regular expressions
* Linux-based development and production environments
* shell scripting, both POSIX and PowerShell
* containerization and virtualization in Kubernetes, OpenStack, Azure, and AWS
* cloud security policy management and hardening


But most importantly, your willingness and ability to quickly learn new, unexpected technologies as the need arises.


**How will a typical day on the job be?**


As a Student Intern in Vulnerability Research[MP1] [MP2] , you will contribute to researching and developing various automated systems, datasets, and software components used in a vulnerability management suite.


You will be contributing to the following areas:[MP3]


* Creating and updating vulnerability signatures
* Developing code for vulnerability assessments
* C[MP4] onfiguring vulnerable testing environments
* Maintaining and improving test suits


But don't worry, you don't need to have a lot of professional experience, the most important part for us is that you are eager and willing to learn and develop your skills!

**But what's in it for you?**


In return for your efforts, we offer you, besides monetary compensation:

* The opportunity to further your skills within the cybersecurity domain
* Being a part of a fun and international team
* A large office in Karlskrona with access to a pool table, shuffleboard and a big terrace with grilling capabilities
* An elaborative set of resources to drive your career, training, and coaching on the job (e.g., LinkedIn Learning)
* A workplace culture where your opinions and ideas are valued and respected

**Did we manage to spark your interest? Then apply today - we're looking forward to receiving your application!**

*As part of the recruitment process, you must be able to pass a background check in order to qualify for this position.*

title: ServiceNow Lead Architect
description:
**Some highlights**
-------------------

* Being part of an international company yet with local presence
* Build a safer digital society together with us

**Working as a ServiceNow Lead Architect**
------------------------------------------


We are looking for a **ServiceNow Lead Architect** who embodies a challenger mentality, ready to own and drive platform innovation while shaping strategic outcomes for our ServiceNow ecosystem. This individual thrives on solving complex problems with creativity, pushing boundaries, and delivering long-term sustainable solutions.  

  

At **Orange Cyberdefense**, we believe in empowering individuals to take innovative approaches to challenges and redefine what’s possible. If you see yourself as someone full of **self-leadership, drive, and creativity**, this is the place where **the sky is the limit**.
  

  

We encourage bold ideas, foster collaboration, and reward those who take ownership and deliver meaningful impact. If you are a confident & expert **ServiceNow developer or architect** looking to step into a broader role with increased influence and responsibility in the ServiceNow ecosystem, this is the perfect opportunity for you. This position offers a chance to expand your impact by combining technical leadership with strategic decision-making and platform ownership.

### **Responsibilities:**

* Platform Optimization
* ServiceNow Practices & Platform Management
* Code & Configuration Reviews
* Strategic Alignment & Leadership
* Value-Driven Delivery
* Collaboration & Innovation
* Virtual Product Ownership

**What we expect of you**
=========================

* **Hands-On Expertise**: Proven experience as a ServiceNow Architect or Senior Developer with a deep understanding of the platform's architecture, capabilities, and best practices.
* **Platform Management Knowledge**: Expertise in managing on-premises and cloud instances, understanding TCO, and setting up best practices for upgrades, clones, and standardization.
* **Strategic Vision**: The ability to connect tactical solutions to a broader strategy and long-term vision for the platform.
* **Problem-Solving Proficiency**: Creativity in solutioning, combined with the ability to deliver quick, hands-on examples to drive implementation.
* **Self-Leadership & Collaboration**: Thrives in an environment that values initiative and teamwork. Excels at aligning stakeholders and delivering results that matter.
* **Innovative Mindset**: Ready to explore new ideas and push boundaries to unlock the platform’s full potential.


At Orange Cyberdefense, **your ambition and leadership determine your growth**. This role is a unique opportunity for those who want to **expand beyond technical expertise** and take on a pivotal position combining architecture, innovation, and product ownership. If you’re ready to lead, innovate, and take the next step in your career, we’d love to hear from you!

  


**Contrat**
-----------

CDI
