 You will provide advocacy and strategic technical guidance to help plan and build solutions using best practices, and proactively keep your customers’ AWS environments operationally healthy. The close relationships developed with your customers will allow you to understand their business/operational needs and technical challenges, and help them achieve the greatest value from AWS. This position will require the ability to travel 10% or more as needed.
   

  

 Watch a short video about life as a Technical Account Manager here: https://bit.ly/3aHfaE0
   

  

 The TAM is the centerpiece of value to our Enterprise Support customers. If you wish to be at the forefront of innovation, come join us!
   

  

 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The
   

  

 AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* You’ll advise on solutions, provide technical guidance and advocate for the customer
* Ensure AWS environments remain operationally healthy whilst reducing cost and complexity
* Develop trusting relationships with customers, understanding their business needs and technical challenges
* Using your technical acumen and customer obsession, you’ll drive technical discussions regarding incidents, trade-offs, and risk management
* Consult with a range of partners from developers through to C-suite executives
* Collaborate with AWS Solutions Architects, Business Developers, Professional Services Consultants, and Sales Account Managers
* With a bias for action, you'll proactively find opportunities for customers to gain additional value from AWS
* Provide detailed reviews of service events, monthly & quarterly metrics, detailed pre-launch planning
* Solve a variety of problems across different customers as they migrate their workloads to the cloud
* Uplift customer capabilities by running workshops, brown bag sessions, etc.


**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience in technical engineering
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent
* Experience in internal enterprise or external customer-facing environment as a technical lead
* Experience in three (3) or more of the following areas: software design or development, content distribution/CDN, scripting/automation, database architecture, IP networking, IT security, BigData/Hadoop/Spark, operations management, service oriented architecture
* Experience in design/implementation/operations/consulting with distributed applications
* Knowledge of of cloud based architecture, cloud services and experience in customer facing roles


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience with AWS services or other cloud offerings
* Experience with operational parameters and troubleshooting for three (4) of the following: compute/storage/networking/CDN/databases/DevOps/big data and analytics/security/applications development in a distributed systems environment
* Experience as a technical account manager, consultant, solutions architect, platform engineer, systems engineer, cloud architect or in a similar role
* Practical knowledge of 5G network architecture and call-flows and experience in troubleshooting 5G networks
* Practical knowledge of OSS/BSS and experience in troubleshooting OSS/BSS products


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A2884267

title: D365 Finance Architect
description:
Job Responsibilities
   

  

**Job Description**
 D365 Finance Architect will lead the design and implementation of Dynamics 365 Finance solutions, ensuring alignment with business processes and industry best practices. The role involves working closely with finance teams, IT stakeholders, and external partners to develop scalable, secure, and high-performance solutions within the Dynamics 365 ecosystem.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 Solution Architecture & Design:
   

  

* Lead the architecture, design, and implementation of Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance (D365 Finance) solutions.
* Translate business requirements into functional and technical designs while ensuring alignment with industry best practices.
* Design scalable and secure solutions that support financial operations, reporting, and compliance.
* Define integration strategies between D365 Finance and other enterprise systems (e.g., CRM, Supply Chain, BI tools).


**Implementation & Customization**
* Guide configuration, customization, and optimization of D365 Finance modules, including General Ledger, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Budgeting, Fixed Assets, and Financial Reporting.
* Develop proof-of-concepts and lead technical validation of solution designs.
* Work closely with development teams to ensure successful implementation of customizations and extensions.
* Establish best practices for data migration, system performance, and user adoption.


**Stakeholder Collaboration & Leadership**
* Work with finance leaders, IT teams, and business stakeholders to define system requirements and priorities.
* Provide strategic recommendations on system improvements, automation, and process optimization.
* Lead discussions on financial reporting, compliance, tax regulations, and auditing requirements in the context of D365 Finance.
* Act as a mentor for functional and technical consultants in the team.


**Continuous Improvement & Innovation**
* Stay updated on Microsoft's roadmap for Dynamics 365 Finance and propose innovative solutions.
* Evaluate emerging technologies (AI, automation, analytics) and their impact on finance processes.
* Optimize finance workflows and reporting by leveraging Power BI, Power Automate, and AI-driven insights.


**Required Qualifications & Skills**
* 8+ years of experience in ERP implementations.
* Strong knowledge of D365 Finance modules (General Ledger, Fixed Assets, Cash & Bank Management, Tax, Budgeting, etc.).
* Experience designing and implementing financial reporting structures, cost allocations, and intercompany accounting.
* Deep understanding of data migrations, integrations (Azure Logic Apps, Power Platform, Data Entities, APIs), and customizations.
* Experience working with multinational financial operations, including multi-currency, tax, and legal entity setups.
* Ability to map finance business processes and recommend system enhancements.
* Strong analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Ability to work in agile environments and lead cross-functional teams.
* Experience in mentoring junior consultants and providing knowledge transfer sessions.


**Preferred Certifications**
* Microsoft Certified: Dynamics 365 Finance Functional Consultant Associate
* Microsoft Certified: Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations Apps Solution Architect Expert.


 Primary Skill
   

  

**D365 Finance Architect - Core finance modules**
 Secondary Skill
   

  

**D365 Functional expert**

title: Strategic Sourcing Manager
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
**Senior Sourcing manager, SW and IT - Tietoevry (m/f/d)**
**About The Job**
 Do you have a strong background in Sourcing of Cloud and Infrastructure SW and/or HW, a passion for problem-solving, and want to join one of the largest tech companies in the Nordics? Then this is the role for you!
   

  

 We are further strengthening our Continuous Services Strategic Sourcing team and are now looking for a senior sourcing manager to join our team. To excel in this role, you need to have extensive experience on strategic sourcing and supplier management, executing sourcing initiatives and have structured, highly collaborative & impact driven working approach.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Actively seeking new opportunities for sourcing initiative pipeline and executing strategic sourcing initiatives, focus on software licenses agreements
* Takes the lead in planning and executing strategic sourcing initiatives, cultivating strong collaboration with Stakeholders
* Sourcing business partner for designated business stakeholders
* Developing category plans to capture short- and long-term business opportunities with financial impact and plan execution of sourcing initiatives
* Proactively lead, plan and drive negotiations, particularly for larger, complex sourcing initiatives
* Managing and securing up-to-date supplier contracts
* Supplier management for designated suppliers. Drive and develop strategic supplier relationship in collaboration with stakeholders
* Provide direction to buyers on suppliers and contracts, to ensure compliance, quality, and efficiency in the purchase-to-pay process.
* Constantly seeking for opportunities to simplify and work in more efficient way
* Contributing to overall team performance as active member of the sourcing team


 We operate as one, integrated Sourcing function. You will be member of Continuous Services Strategic Sourcing team and report to Monica Derksen.
   

  

**Personality & working style:**
 You are an engaging and business minded sourcing professional with extensive experience of strategic sourcing and a proven track record of negotiating significant sourcing initiatives and supplier management to ensure execution of the negotiated deal:
   

  

* Doer who has bias for action & delivering impact – highly structured way-of-working, impact-oriented approach and independent (self-starter) working style
* Influencing and presenting skills – you have ability to communicate effectively both with executives and specialists and genuine desire & ability to deliver business impact to the company
* Highly analytical & fact-based – you can both see the big picture, identify long term trends and to drill down to drivers when needed. You use data to drive real business benefits and bring speed to decision making and execution
* Result oriented project manager - Being able to identify new opportunities to create impact, prioritize the work and secure successful implementation of these initiatives
* Highly skilled in negotiation, indirect influencing and selling ideas in complex matrix organizations.
* Team player who can contribute to teamwork, also in areas outside of own direct responsibilities


**Experience & education:**
* 10+ years of strategic sourcing experience with a proven track record of negotiating significant sourcing initiatives and managing global suppliers
* Experience in working with global software and/or hardware suppliers is preferred
* Experience in software licensing from infrastructure, security and compliance, and cloud based -solutions business models is preferred
* Proven negotiation skills
* Experience in building and managing strategic supplier relationship to maximize value
* Experience of managing spend and using TCO (total cost of ownership) to minimize waste
* Experience from working in international organization with complex business models and matrix organization
* M.Sc. from relevant field
* Fully proficient written and verbal English communication skills


 Location options: Solna, Espoo
   

  

 Did we get you inspired?
   

  

 We look forward to your application!
   

  

 Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we will reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Monica Derksen, monica.derksen@tietoevry.com
   

  

 Hope to hear from you soon!
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Payroll Consultant
company_industry: Software Development, Financial Services, and Human Resources Services
description:
**JOB TITLE: Lönekonsult**
**Placering:** 
**Östermalmtorg 1, 114 42 Stockholm, Sweden**
**Hybrid**
**Om ADP Sverige AB**
**Välkommen till ADP Sverige AB, vi har öppnat vårt första kontor i Norden i september 2023 och befinner oss i en tillväxtperiod där vi satsar på att utöka vårt team i våra kontorslokaler på Östermalm. Vi erbjuder ett ständigt utvecklande arbete med spännande kunder i en global miljö. ADP finns i ett stort antal länder i hela världen och en av de största aktörerna inom löneoutsourcing med digitala HR-lösningar och arbetar ständigt med AI lösningar för att säkra och utveckla våra leveranser.**
**Rollbeskrivning**
**I din roll kommer du att;**
 Vara en rådgivande part till våra kunder, säkerställa att aktuella lagar och regelverk efterföljs.
   

  

 Eget kundansvar
   

  

 Vi är ett team som samarbetar och kompletterar varandras styrkor och kompetenser inom alla olika områden såsom pensioner, svenska lagar och kollektivavtal.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer Och Personliga Egenskaper**
* Erfarenhet av självständigt lönearbete, minst 2 år. Gärna inom outsourcingbranschen och hanterat hela processen, från ax till limpa.
* Utbildning, eftergymnasial utbildning inom lön lönespecialist/lönekonsult
* God systemvana, lönesystem, tid och-resa, samt övriga ärendehanteringssystem, vi använder oss av Hogia Lön +
* Goda kunskaper av Excel
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, tal och skrift
* Serviceminded, självgående och lösningsorienterad
* Teamplayer
* Integritet
* GDPR


**Rollbeskrivning -Huvudsakliga Ansvarsområden**
* Säkerställa korrekt och punktlig lönehantering i enlighet med avtalade deadlines och kundens behov.
* Fungera som primär kontaktperson för kunder och leverera högkvalitativ service samt sakkunnig rådgivning inom löneområdet.
* Tolka och tillämpa kollektivavtal samt företagsspecifika policys och riktlinjer.
* Uppdatera och underhålla dokumentation, processbeskrivningar och interna rutiner för att säkerställa kontinuerlig effektivitet och efterlevnad.
* Arbeta proaktivt med planering och prioritera arbetsuppgifter för att optimera arbetsflöden och leveranser. Hantera lönejusteringar, korrigeringar samt uppdateringar av löner i enlighet med gällande lagar och bestämmelser.
* Bidra till teamets gemensamma mål genom ett lösningsorienterat och samarbetsinriktat arbetssätt
* Tillhandahålla professionellt stöd och rådgivning till kunder i specifika lönefrågor.


**Vad Vi Erbjuder**
**ADP är en inkluderande organisation,**
* Hybrid, 3-2
* Generös friskvårdsbidrag
* Flextid
* 39 timmars veckoarbetstid
* Tjänstepension
* Var dig själv i en kultur som värdesätter rättvisa, inkludering och tillhörighet och ger utrymme för olika perspektiv och insikter.
* Tillhörighet gå med i en av tio Business Resource Groups där du kan ansluta globalt med nätverk och allierade som delar gemensamma intressen och erfarenheter.
* Goda karriärmöjligheter i en dynamisk miljö med många möjligheter att utvecklas.
* Var din hälsosammaste genom bra förmåner från dag 1.
* Fokus på mental hälsa och välmående vi är här för att ge exceptionell service till våra kunder, och inget av det händer utan att var och en av oss tar hand om oss själva och finns där för varandra.
* Arbeta på ett förtag som är dedikerad att ge tillbaka och skapa en varaktig, positiv inverkan på de samhällen där vi arbetar och lever.
* Ge tillbaka betald ledighet volontärarbete för ändamål


**A little about ADP:** 
 We are a comprehensive global provider of cloud-based human capital management (HCM) solutions that unite HR, payroll, talent, time, tax and benefits administration and a leader in business outsourcing services, analytics, and compliance expertise. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating a down-to-earth culture that embraces our core values, welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition for our work by many esteemed organizations, learn more at ADP Awards and Recognition.
   

  

**Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP:** 
 ADP is committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace, and is further committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic including: race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status or disability. Hiring decisions are based upon ADP’s operating needs, and applicant merit including, but not limited to, qualifications, experience, ability, availability, cooperation, and job performance.
   

  

**Ethics at ADP:** 
 ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP’s culture and our full set of values.

title: Marknadskoordinator
description:
Vi på GF ser oss själva som en framtidsinriktad ledare inom vårt område. Sedan 1802 har vi engagerat oss i innovationer och hållbara lösningar av högsta kvalitet som tillför värde i vardagen för människor runt om i världen.
   

  

 Är du redo för ett nästa steg i din karriär och vill arbeta med marknadsföring, kommunikation och databashantering? Som Marknadskoordinator hos oss på GF är du den svenska representanten i det nordeuropeiska markandsföringsteamet på tio personer. Du arbetar med den svenska marknaden och planerar samt utför aktiviteter inom divisionens globala marknadsföringsprogram. Du samarbetar med de lokala, regionala och globala marknads- och kommunikationsteamen. Du har även ett nära samarbete med och rapporterar till vår Country Manager i Sverige.
   

  

**Dina uppgifter**
* Digitala marknadsföringsaktiviteter i våra olika kanaler och plattformar.
* Underhåll av den svenska hemsidan, inklusive översättningar, för att se till att information är uppdaterad och tillgänglig på den lokala marknaden.
* Systemadministration och databashantering.
* Anpassning av globala förlagor till broschyrer, datablad och annat tryckt material.
* Koordination av event och mässor tillsammans med kollegor inom säljorganisationen.
* Hålla koll på och driva leads genom marknadsföring samt rapportera status och resultat regelbundet.
* Stärka samarbetet mellan sälj- och marknadsteamet, inklusive försäljningsaktiviteter.
* Stötta effektiv intern och extern kommunikation, inklusive PR, för att driva exponering av GF inom de viktigaste marknadssegmenten.
* Ta fram och utveckla referenscase.


**Din profil**
* Utbildning från högskola, universitet alternativt yrkeshögskola inom marknadsföring och/eller kommunikation.
* 2-3 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom B2B marknadsföring och kommunikation.
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla och genomföra marknadsföringskampanjer och event.
* Erfarenhet av digital marknadsföring och sociala mediekampanjer.
* Grundläggande kunskaper i Adobe Creative Cloud och molnbaserad asset management system.
* Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av CRM-system.
* Du är bekväm med att arbeta både med strategiskt och operativ marknadsföring.
* Du blir en del av ett nordeuropeiskt team, det är därför viktigt att du pratar och skriver både svenska och engelska obehindrat.
* Som person är du kommunikativ och organiserad. Du är bra på att prioritera bland arbetsuppgifter och har förmågan att hantera flera olika projekt och uppgifter samtidigt.


**Benefits**
**Tydlig vision och mål**
 "Vi är en hållbarhets- och innovationsledare som ger stort mervärde för våra kunder" är vår vision som vägleder oss. Vårt syfte "att bli bättre varje dag - sedan 1802" inspirerar oss i det dagliga arbetet.
   

  

**Hållbarhet och innovation**
 Vi har höga hållbarhets- och innovationsmål. Tillsammans arbetar vi för en hållbar framtid.
   

  

**Utbildningsverktyg för din utveckling**
 På GF erbjuder vi utvecklingsmöjligheter för alla våra anställda. Vi har globala utbildningsverktyg och utbilningar inom många olika områden.
   

  

**Attraktiva karriärmöjligheter**
 Som ett globalt företag erbjuder vi på GF många möjligheter för karriärutveckling. Vi har också ett talangprogram (MyNextBigStep@GF) för att stärka just din karriär.
   

  

**Din kontakt**
 Clara Hednert
   

  

 HR Manager Nordics
   

  

 +46 8 506 775 00
   

  

 clara.hednert@georgfischer.com
   

  

 Liljeholmsstranden 5
   

  

 11743 Stockholm
   

  

 Sweden
   

  

**Your work route**
 Sweden, Stockholm

title: SAP S/4 Technology Architect, Svenska Försvarsmakten
description:
**Accentures svenska SAP-affärsområde**
 Som marknadsledande affärspartner sedan över 40 år tillbaka arbetar vi med SAP end-to-end, med allt från produktinnovation till utveckling och leverans. Vi driver flera stora SAP-transformationsprojekt med några av de största företagen i Norden. Inom vårt nordiska SAP-community arbetar vi med de senaste SAP-lösningarna och tjänsterna såsom SAP S/4 HANA Cloud, SAP D&S, Ariba, SuccessFactors, SAP BTP och SAP RISE.
   

  

 Accenture är ledande på marknaden med teknologisk och funktionell expertis inom områden som finans, logistik, inköp, HR och dataanalys inom flertalet industrier inklusive Försvarssektorn. Vi har ett starkt hållbarhetsfokus och hjälper kunder att definiera och möjliggöra hållbarhetsstrategier samtidigt som vi skapar affärsvärlden för kunden.
   

  

  

  

**Rollen**
 Vi expanderar just nu vår svenska SAP-community och letar efter erfarna SAP-konsulter inom finans, logistik och teknologi för olika positioner inom försvarssektorn i Sverige. Du kommer att få en unik möjlighet att delta i projekt som är avgörande för våra kunders framgång inom den dynamiska försvarssektorn.
   

  

*Varför välja Accenture?*
 Bli en del av Accenture och anslut dig till ett passionerat team som är dedikerat till teknik, innovation och personlig utveckling. Vi är ledande inom SAP-innovation inom försvarssektorn och gör en positiv skillnad inom industrin även globalt.
   

  

  

- Karriärmöjligheter: Få tillgång till omfattande möjligheter för karriärutveckling med utbildning, certifieringar och en tydlig väg för framsteg.

- Inkluderande kultur: Bli en del av ett samarbetsvilligt team med stor mångfald i en arbetsmiljö som värderar din insats och välmående.

- Cutting-Edge Resources: Få tillgång till den senaste teknologin och verktygen för att utmärka dig inom försvarsområde och arbeta med innovativa projekt.

**SAP S/4 Technical Architect**
 Du kommer att vara en del av ett spännande team, samarbeta och leda teamet för att prestera på bästa sätt. Som expert inom SAP Teknologisk Arkitektur kommer du att vara ansvarig för att fatta viktiga beslut och tillhandahålla lösningar på problem som gäller för flera team. Dina bidrag kommer att vara mycket uppskattade då du engagerar dig med flera team och bidrar till viktiga beslut. Ansök nu och bli en del av vår innovativa och dynamiska miljö!
   

  

 Följande är några arbetsuppgifter i det dagliga arbetet, Identifiera omfattning, definiera krav och skapa funktionella och/eller tekniska specifikationer. Utveckla och stödja proof of concepts, uppskattningar och konceptuella designer. Samordna implementeringen av lösningen och stödja förändringsarbetet.
   

  

 Plats: Enköping
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
- Erfarenhet och SAP inom finans, logistik, Inköp, Teknologi företrädesvis med internationella teknikföretag eller slutanvändarkunder

- Konfigurering i SAP

- Erfarenhet av SAP ABAP utveckling

- Avancerad kompetens inom Teknologisk Arkitektur

- Avancerad kompetens inom Arkitektonisk Design

- Kandidat- eller magisterexamen

- Bosatt i Sverige, eller villig att flytta till Sverige (inom EU)

- Svenska språkkunskaper i tal och skrift

 Om du är redo att ansluta dig till vårt dynamiska team och bidra till SAP-världen inom försvarssektorn, ser vi fram emot din ansökan för din önskade position. Skicka in ditt CV där du beskriver din relevanta erfarenhet och kvalifikationer. Delta i att forma framtidens affärer genom SAP-innovation och gör en positiv inverkan inom försvarssektorn. För mer information om vår SAP-praxis, besök oss på https://www.accenture.com/se-en/services/sap-index.

title: Forskare i Software Engineering
description:
Göteborgs universitet möter samhällets utmaningar med mångsidig kunskap. 56 000 studenter och 6 600 medarbetare gör universitetet till en stor och inspirerande arbetsplats. Stark forskning och attraktiva utbildningar lockar forskare och studenter från hela världen. Med ny kunskap och nya perspektiv bidrar Göteborgs universitet till en bättre framtid.


Institutionen för data- och informationsteknik har en internationell prägel med cirka 300 anställda från över 30 olika länder. Institutionen är en integrerad institution med både Göteborgs universitet och Chalmers tekniska högskola som huvudmän.
  

  

Institutionen för data- och informationsteknik söker en forskare. Anställningen är placerad vid avdelningen för Interaktionsdesign och Software Engineering vid institutionen, med Göteborgs universitet som arbetsgivare.



Idag är AI-ingenjörer och trafiksäkerhetsexperter beroende av datadrivna ingenjörsprocesser för utveckling och bedömning av avancerade förarassistanssystem (ADAS) eller komponenter i automatiserade körsystem (ADS). Att effektivt förstå befintlig information och på ett tillförlitligt sätt identifiera saknade värden i en datamängd är dock avgörande eftersom AI/ML-aktiverade tillvägagångssätt i allt högre grad utforskas även för säkerhetskritiska komponenter som perceptionssystem.


**Arbetsuppgifter**



Arbetet i projektet består till 80% av forskning och 20% undervisning inom området mjukvara.



I detta projekt syftar vi till att bedriva forskning inom området beräkningseffektiv informationsinhämtning baserad (till exempel baserad på fyllande kurvor för dimensionalitetsreduktion) på stora språkmodeller (LLM) och grundmodeller (FM) för att stödja den systematiska analysen av fordonsdatauppsättningar. Forskningsuppgifterna i detta projekt är kopplade till detta mål och består av att granska relaterad litteratur och genomföra experiment med datauppsättning(ar) och tillvägagångssätt/algoritmer inom området AI/ML och LLM/FM.



Undervisningsdelen består av föreläsningar, handledning av övningar, handledning av kandidat- och masteruppsatser under högst 20 % av heltid.


**Kvalifikationer**



Krav för tjänsten är en doktorsexamen i programvaruteknik eller datavetenskap eller ett relaterat område.



Kandidaten behöver ha:


* Grundläggande kunskap om tillämpad AI/ML,
* Grundläggande kunskap om MLOps (datateknik (förberedelse, rengöring, märkning, …), ML-träning och justering, implementering och övervakning av ML-modeller,

Erfarenhet av att planera, genomföra och analysera forskning inom tillämpad informationsteknologi, datavetenskap och programvaruteknik genom att använda till exempel Action Research och Design Science.  
* 

Dessutom är följande meriterande:


* Goda programmeringskunskaper (Python, C++, Go) och erfarenhet av Linux,
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med tidsseriedata, helst från fordonsdomänen (fordonsrörelse, video, lidar, radar),
* Erfarenhet av rymdfyllande kurvor,
* Publicerade artiklar i välrenommerade konferenser och/eller tidskrifter,
* Erfarenhet av självgående forskning inom fordonsindustrin,
* Undervisningserfarenhet, och
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska

**Anställning**



Anställningsform: Tidsbegränsad anställning 12 månader  

Omfattning: 100% heltid  

Placering: Institutionen för data- och informationsteknik, avdelningen för Interaktionsdesign och Software Engineering  

Tillträde: 2025-06-01 eller enligt överenskommelse


**Kontaktuppgifter för anställningen**



Har du frågor om forskningsprojektet är du välkommen att kontakta Christian Berger christian.berger@gu.se  

Har du frågor om anställningen är du välkommen att kontakta Eric Knauss eric.knauss@cse.gu.se
  

Har du frågor om anställningsförfarandet är du välkommen att kontakta Sanna Staf sanna.staf@cse.gu.se


**Fackliga organisationer**



Fackliga företrädare vid Göteborgs universitet hittar du här: https://www.gu.se/om-universitetet/jobba-hos-oss/hjalp-for-sokande


**Ansökan**



Du söker anställningen via Göteborgs universitets rekryteringsportal genom att klicka på knappen "Ansök". Du som sökande ansvarar för att ansökan är komplett i enlighet med annonsen och att den är universitetet tillhanda senast sista ansökningsdag.



Ansökan ska vara skriven på engelska.



Anökan ska innehålla följande:


* Personligt brev som sammanfattar din meritlista och beskriver dina forskningsintressen i förhållande till den utlysta tjänsten
* Komplett CV
* Intyg om genomförd doktorsavhandling


**Ansökan ska vara inkommen senast**: 2025-04-18

  


Universitetet arbetar aktivt för en arbetsmiljö med jämställda förhållanden och sätter värde på de kvalitéer mångfald tillför verksamheten.
  

  

Universitetet tillämpar individuell lönesättning.
  

  

Enligt Riksarkivets föreskrifter är universitetet skyldigt att förvara ansökningshandlingar i två år efter tillsättningsbeslutet. Om du som sökande till en anställning särskilt begär tillbaka dina handlingar återsänds de när de två åren har förflutit, i annat fall kommer de att gallras ut.
  

  

Till bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag och till dig som är försäljare: Göteborgs universitet anlitar upphandlad annonsbyrå i samband med rekrytering av personal. Vi undanber oss vänligen men bestämt direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av jobbannonser.

title: Engineering Manager
description:
Urval sker löpande Lund Hybrid
  
  

**Det vi gör är inte så himla komplicerat:** vi skapar en värld av bättre kundupplevelser och gör vardagen enklare för våra kunder genom att göra grymma saker. Det vi gör mest är att utveckla, sälja och implementera CRM-lösningar till europeiska företag. Du kommer att vara en viktig kulturbärare och ha en nyckelroll i att forma såväl team som teknik.
  
  

Om du är en inspirerande ledare med passion för att skapa resultat och kundfokus kan detta vara ditt nästa drömjobb!
  
  

Vad kommer du att göra?
  
  

Här får du möjlighet att coacha ett högt presterande utvecklingsteam i världens bästa bolag (i alla fall enligt oss!). Du skapar och bidrar till en stark kultur och kommer att jobba mycket med teambuilding. Att kunna steppa in, koda och vara en del av lösningar är en naturlig del av rollen.
  
  

Du som Engineering Manager ges stort ansvar för att bygga och utveckla vårt team samt säkerställa att kunden är i centrum och där vi alltid förstår affärsvärdet av det vi levererar. Du kommer att vara drivande när det gäller förändringsarbete och att effektivisera organisationen. Därtill jobbar du tätt med design, produktledning och vår Head of Technology, som ansvarar för den tekniska visionen, för att säkerställa att vi utvecklar lösningar som är både innovativa och användarvänliga.
  
  

Några av våra medarbetare
  
Anna-Mari Ewing
  
Sales Operations Specialist
  
"Om du ger uttryck för dina ambitioner och vad du behöver för stöd, så finns det stora möjligheter att utveckla din karriär med oss."
  
Matilda Alm
  
Account Manager
  
"På Lime trivs jag med fantastiska kollegor och en inspirerande kultur. Möjligheterna att utmanas och växa som säljare gör varje dag spännande och unik."
  
Terry Ilebode
  
Software Engineer
  
"Lime ger mig ett holistiskt stöd i alla delar av mitt liv genom att både utmana mig som mjukvaruutvecklare och ge mig stöd i min personliga utveckling."
  
Henrik Kjærvik
  
Head of Expert Services
  
"Det bästa med att jobba på Lime, förutom kollegorna så klart, är flexibiliteten och möjligheterna att utveckla din karriär i linje med dina egna mål och ambitioner."
  
Kvalifikationer
  
  

Vem är du?
  
  

Du har flerårig erfarenhet som utvecklare.
  
Du har ledarskapserfarenhet, gärna av att leda tekniska team och driva förändringsprocesser.
  
Du har relevant utbildning för rollen, gärna en teknisk akademisk sådan.
  
Kan kommunicera i skrift och verbalt på såväl svenska som engelska.
  
  

Rent personlighetsmässigt tänker vi oss att du är en stark och inspirerande ledare som kan bygga en positiv och högpresterande kultur. Du uppskattar kombinationen av att ha ett strategisk synsätt, men trivs också i operativa utmaningar. Med din goda erfarenhet av programmering är du med och bidrar i tekniska diskussioner. Likt dina kollegor kan du hålla ett högt tempo och får saker gjorda – du ser helt enkelt möjligheter och agerar snabbt. Dessutom är du bekväm med att presentera dina idéer och lösningar internt såväl som externt och gör detta på ett kommunikativt och inspirerande sätt.
  
  

Vad erbjuder vi dig?
  
  

Helt ödmjukt kan vi berätta att vi har en fantastisk kultur på Lime! När du går in genom dörren kommer du att slås av den värme vi utstrålar och träffa ett stort gäng härliga kollegor.
  
  

För att ge dig ett axplock av vad du kan förvänta dig av oss, så kan vi garantera dig:
  
  

Ett nästa steg i din karriär och en väldigt spännande framtid. Det händer otroligt mycket på Lime!
  
En arbetsplats där du får stor frihet att påverka och forma framtiden.
  
Ett härligt team som brinner för kunden, teknik, entreprenörskap och samarbete.
  
Möjligheten att göra skillnad. Vi är inte vilket företag som helst och det får vi aldrig bli!
  
Utvecklande och givande konferenser. Du kommer att ständigt utvecklas och hjälpa andra att göra detsamma.
  
Finfina förmåner; friskvårdsbidrag, försäkringar, kollektivavtal, möjlighet till löneväxling, trevliga rabatter, fika och en hel drös med annat gottigt!
  
  

**Men viktigast av allt:** att vara på Lime är inte ett jobb, det är en livsstil! Vi arbetar inte med CRM, utan vi ser till att sprida kundkärlek och bygga en värld där kundernas förväntan ständigt överträffas.
  
  

Processen?
  
  

Vi tillämpar löpande urval, vilket innebär att vi driver rekryteringsprocessen kontinuerligt tills vi hittat den där handen-i-handsken-matchningen. I första steget screenar vi på din ansökan. Därefter följer intervjuer, praktiska case, tester och referenstagning. Vår process avslutas alltid med slutintervju med vår VD Nils.
  
  

Konferenser och sociala aktiviteter
  
  

Träning och utveckling
  
  

Balans i (jobb)livet
  
  

Kaffe, dricka och fika
  
  

Hälsa och välmående
  
  

Bygga Lime tillsammans
  
  

Om företaget
  
  

Lime är ett börsnoterat techbolag med 9 kontor i 6 länder. Vi växer konstant med ca 20 % per år och öppnade under hösten 2020 vårt första utomnordiska kontor i Nederländerna. Sedan dess har vi äntrat Tyskland och har ständigt ögonen öppna för nya, potentiella marknader. Men det där är bara siffror och fakta. Det riktigt härliga med Lime är vi som jobbar här - ett stort gäng omtänksamma, ambitiösa kollegor som kämpar för en värld där alla kundupplevelser överträffar förväntningarna. Med hjälp av smart teknik och träffsäker expertis förenklar vi kunders vardag och skapar förutsättningar för det där lilla extra. Något som fortfarande är unikt för ett mjukvarubolag som Lime är också att vi sköter hela produktlivscykeln själva - allt från utveckling, till leverans, till support. Vi tar helt enkelt ansvar för att kedjan är hel och välfungerande, med en twist. Vi kallar det #dontbreakthechain.
  
  

Lime grundades av tre studenter i Lund år 1990
  
  

Lime klimatkompenserar genom grön el från en solcellspark utanför Sjöbo
  
  

Lime har gjort sex företagsförvärv sedan år 2017
  
  

Limes nuvarande VD Nils började som en av de första traineerna år 2006
  
  

Lime introducerades på Nasdaq i Stockholm år 2018
  
  

Lime lanserade sitt omvända mentorskapsprogram år 2019
  
  

Limes mjukvara har en räckvidd på ca 100 miljoner människor dagligen
  
  

Therese Boutayeb | Kontaktperson
company_description: Looking for a boring employer? Look elsewhere! At Lime, we love customer care, sales and case management! We love to deliver that “something special” – while having a lot of fun along the way.

title: System Verification Engineer
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**Introduction**
----------------


We are looking for a Verification Engineer that can join our group **Inhouse Software Development** within the department **Electrical & Software Architecture**. Volvo Bus Corporation (VBC) inherit big parts of the software from Group Trucks Technology (GTT) but some parts we develop ourself within our group; Instrument Cluster (IC3 + IC-gfx) and the Body Builder interface nodes (BBM, BIM, BIO).


To succeed in the role as verification engineer you shall have the interest in test and verification. Years of experience is valuable but interest and a front-leaning personality strikes high for this position.

**Main area of responsibility**
-------------------------------

* Component testing in HIL rig and BoxBus
* Fault tracing
* Develop, write, preform and report test cases based on the requirement or system
* Bug fixes
* Securing quality and readiness before release


You will be included in one of our teams and work according to the Lean way of working

**This is you**
---------------

* B.Sc. or M.Sc degree in electrical/ software engineering or equivalent
* Test and verification experience, preferrable from automotive
* Programming experience (preferrable Python, Bash or CAPL)
* Self-motivated, you will belong to an experienced team but must be able to take own initiative

  

Nice to have

* Experience from Vector tools such as CANalyzer and CANoe
**Contact**
-----------


If you have any questions, please contact:

  

Mona Teien Borkmann, HR Business Partner, mona.teien.borkmann@volvo.com,


Emma Sjöström, Recruiting manager, emma.sjostrom@volvo.com

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

At **Volvo Buses** you join one of the world’s leading providers of sustainable people transport solutions. What we do affects millions of people around the world: passengers, drivers, customers; in fact, entire cities and countries. This job gives you the opportunity to work with the future of people transportation and infrastructure. We have a strong culture of working together to help each other, sharing knowledge and experience. Together, we shape the world we want to live in.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Software Systems Engineer – Automotive
description:
### **Responsibilities**


* Define, analyze, and decompose software system requirements for automotive applications.
* Ensure proper traceability and alignment between system and software requirements.
* Collaborate with hardware, software, and testing teams to define and refine implementation requirements.
* Lead the development of software requirements specifications in compliance with ASPICE processes.
* Support End of Line (EOL) development.
* Ensure the correct integration of software components within EDU, inverter, Parklock, and disconnect systems.
* Develop and review test plans to validate software system behavior.
* Provide technical guidance on system architecture and software integration strategies.
* Work closely with project management to ensure software deliverables meet functional and quality requirements.
* Address and resolve software-related issues identified in testing or production.
* Lead technical discussions related to software system architecture and implementation.
* Support troubleshooting and root cause analysis of system-level issues.
* Ensure robust documentation of software requirements, test plans, and validation results.
* Provide mentorship and guidance to software engineers on best practices and requirement handling.


**Requirements**


* Experience in software system development within the automotive industry.
* Strong background in software and electronics.
* Experience in developing inverters, Parklocks and disconnect systems.
* Proven experience in software system requirement handling, decomposition, and traceability.
* Expertise in ASPICE (Automotive SPICE) processes and compliance.
* Hands-on experience with test planning, validation, and verification.
* Good knowledge of End of Line (EOL) system development.

title: Mechanical design engineer
emails: liselotte.engdahl@siemens-energy.com, Daniel.carlsson.ext@siemens-energy.com, unionen.finspang.se@siemens-energy.com, asi.se@siemens-energy.com, jan.h.lundgren@siemens-energy.com, mikael.malmgren@siemens-energy.com
description:
**A Snapshot of Your Day**


We are looking for a designer for our pipe installation department in order engineering!


In your daily work, you will work with pipe design for the auxiliary systems of our gas turbines. You work in project teams to find solutions to technical challenges and meet our customers' expectations around the world. You take full responsibility for your solution from design to installation by using tools such as the CAD tool NX and Teamcenter.

**How You’ll Make an Impact**

* Act as the responsible mechanical engineer in assigned order projects, ensuring all designs are meticulously crafted to meet customer specifications and requirements.
* Develop and implement innovative solutions, taking ownership of tasks from start to finish.
* Provide support to home assembly, site operations, and subcontractors with expertise on design and installation.
* Be a great teammate, embracing a collaborative spirit across different interfaces.
* Show a track record of effectively organizing and prioritizing work to achieve project achievements.

**What You Bring**


We believe that you are characterized by being thorough, structured, and thrives in a collaborative environment. You are quality-conscious with the ability to prioritize effectively within project timelines. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills are essential, as you will be building partnerships both internally and externally. Being adaptable and open to diverse cultures and perspectives is a must. Proficiency in English, both spoken and written, is required as it is our corporate language.

* A degree in Engineering, MSc or BSc, or equivalent experience.
* Proven expertise in mechanical design, preferably in pipe design and knowledge about Pressure Equipment Directive.
* Familiarity with gas turbines and their auxiliary systems is an advantage
* Proficiency in CAD software, preferably NX.

**About the Team**


Join our dynamic team of about 20 engineers from different parts of the world, each brining their own distinct backgrounds and experiences. Our team thrives on collaboration, allowing us to collectively tackle technical challenges and achieve our ambitious objectives!


Our **Gas Services division** offers Low-emission power generation through service and decarbonization. Zero or low emission power generation and all gas turbines under one roof, steam turbines and generators. Decarbonization opportunities through service offerings, modernization, and digitalization of the fleet.


We can offer you employment benefits such as: reduction of working hours, advance vacation, health care allowance and an eventual possibility to a flexible working place.

**Who is Siemens Energy?**


At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. With ~100,000 dedicated employees in more than 90 countries, we develop the energy systems of the future, ensuring that the growing energy demand of the global community is met reliably and sustainably. The technologies created in our research departments and factories drive the energy transition and provide the base for one sixth of the world's electricity generation.


Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation.


Find out how you can make a difference at Siemens Energy: https://www.siemens-energy.com/employeevideo

**Our Commitment to Diversity**


Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity, we generate power. We run on inclusion and our combined creative energy is fueled by over 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society, all of society, and we do not discriminate based on our differences.

**Application**


Don’t hesitate – apply via https://jobs.siemens-energy.com/en\_US/jobs, id nr no later than 2025-04-13.


Ongoing selection is applied, the role might be filled before last application date.


For questions about the role, please contact the recruiting manager Liselotte Engdahl on liselotte.engdahl@siemens-energy.com


For questions about the recruitment process please contact the responsible recruiter Daniel Carlsson on Daniel.carlsson.ext@siemens-energy.com


We refrain from all contact with staffing and recruitment companies, or advertising brokers.


Location: Finspång

**Trade Union Representatives:**  

Unionen, unionen.finspang.se@siemens-energy.com  

Sveriges Ingenjörer & SACO, asi.se@siemens-energy.com  

Ledarna, Jan Lundgren jan.h.lundgren@siemens-energy.com  

IF Metall, Mikael Malmgren, mikael.malmgren@siemens-energy.com
company_description: At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. We meet the growing energy demand across 90+ countries while ensuring our climate is protected.

title: Technical Operations Engineer
description:
Technical Operation Engineer - Python & Linux specialist for our office in Gothenburg, Sweden
  
The team you will be working with consists of Technical Operations engineers (internally referred to as Service Managers), Systems Experts and Service Delivery Managers handling multiple customers globally.
  
  

**Position Responsibilities:**  

* Become an authority on several production system installations in terms of managing the technical aspects of the applications.
* Participate in ongoing implementation projects
* Provide advanced technical support, in relation to the Service Level Agreement(s), for the Crew and Network Ops portfolio focusing mainly on the day of operation products.
* Assist the client with knowledge injections, proactive problem solving and daily management of the production installation
* Maintain Linux installations on company servers and make recommendations to clients on patches/upgrades
* Work with System requirements with internal and external stakeholders
* To be on roster (24x7 standby) every fourth to fifth week


This position is hybrid. This means that the selected candidate will be required to perform some work onsite 2 days a week. This is at the hiring team’s discretion and could potentially change in the future.
  
  

**Show Sponsorship:****Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):**  

* 4 or more years in software development or advanced technical support role
* Good knowledge in Python language
* Good knowledge of Unix and/or Linux
* Good knowledge with shell scripting
* Familiar with AWS concepts
* Good knowledge in version control systems such as Git and Mercurial
* Fluency in English language


**Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):**  

* 6 or more years in software development or advanced technical support role
* Particular interest in technical problem solving
* Experience with AWS
* 24X7 work environment on call
* Strong programming skills (Java an advantage)
* Databases (Oracle or Postgresql)
* Knowledge of Kubernetes is beneficial
* Messaging systems such as Activemq
* Customer relationship experience is advantageous
* Highly responsible, able to take ownership of issues
* Strong technical & analytical aptitude
* Able to work independently and within a team


**Typical Education/Experience:**  

Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education (e.g. Bachelor/Masters) and typically 4 or more years' related work experience.
  
  

**Relocation:**

title: Development Engineer
description:
**Are you passionate about innovation and technology? Do you thrive in an environment where problem-solving and creativity go hand in hand? Airolit, a leading drone manufacturer based in Mölndal, is looking for a curious and open-minded Development Engineer to join our team and help shape the future of autonomous aerial solutions.**

### **About the Role**


As a Development Engineer at Airolit, you will play a crucial role in designing and developing innovative drone solutions. Our mission is to push the boundaries of drone technology, ensuring efficiency, reliability, and adaptability for various applications. You will be involved in both the development of new cutting edge solutions and the continuous improvement of existing products. Your responsibilities will include:

* Designing drone components and systems.

  

* Managing the PLM and ERP system integration with engineering.

  

* Create and review CAD drawings.

  

* Developing, testing, and validating prototypes in real-world environments.
* Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, including software, electronic, production and procurement.
* Analysing and resolving technical challenges, ensuring optimal performance and safety.

  

* Continuously improving design and development processes to enhance efficiency and product quality.

### **Who we think you are**


You..

* .. are organised and like to build and maintain structure.
* .. have a passion for problem-solving and enjoy developing smart, efficient solutions.
* .. are curious to improve products and processes.
* .. enjoy working both independently and as part of a team, knowing that collaboration leads to the best outcomes.
* .. communicate effectively and engage proactively with team members and stakeholders.
* .. embrace feedback and continuously strive to improve your work and skills.
* .. are humble and treat colleagues with respect and professionalism.

**Your background**  

* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in mechanical engineering, automotive or aerospace engineering, or a related field.
* At least 5 years of experience in design engineering and product development.
* Experience with CAD software, like Fusion 360, Inventor or Solid works and ERP and PLM systems.
* Experience with drone systems, UAV technology, or robotics is highly meriting.
* Knowledge of aerodynamics, lightweight materials, and mechanical structures is a plus.
* Proficiency in English is required; fluency in Swedish is a plus.

### **What we offer**

* A dynamic and innovative work environment where your ideas matter.
* Opportunities for personal and professional development.

  

* Competitive salary and benefits package.

  

* Flexible working hours.

  

* The chance to work with cutting-edge technology and make an impact in the drone industry


* Fly drones and get paid!

  


### **About Airolit**


Airolit is a Swedish-owned company dedicated to developing, designing, and manufacturing advanced Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs). All development and production take place in Sweden, ensuring the highest standards of quality and innovation.


Airolit collaborate closely with clients across diverse sectors, including defense, security, and infrastructure, to deliver tailored solutions that meet their unique operational needs.


The mission is to drive the development of building a Nordic UAV capability.

### **Start**


We would like to have you in the team as soon as possible, with respect to period of notice to your current employer.

title: Technical Lead – Automation & Validation
description:
**We are looking for a "Technical Lead (System Engineer)- Automation & Validation" for a global company in Lund.**

**Start is ASAP, 1 year's limited contract to begin with, possibility of extension after that.**

  

In this role, you will be part of developing and implementing the next generation of the Homogenizer automation platform. You will ensure that the technical maturity of the solution evolves according to requirements while maintaining compliance with food safety and equipment safety standards.


In this role you will work in a dynamic organization where you will closely cooperate with several stakeholders, both internally and externally.

**You will focus on:**

* Defining the system under development and establishing verification and validation strategies with relevant stakeholders.
* Managing the technical maturity of the solution by leading verification and validation planning and execution.
* Leading technical risk management, including food safety and equipment safety.
* Driving and initiating improvement activities.

**Required skills:**

* A Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent.
* At least 5 years of relevant work experience in the field.
* A solid technical understanding and familiarity with product development processes and tools.
* Knowledge or experience with automation systems, software, and processes within the area.
* Fluency in both English and Swedish.

**Preferred skills:**

* Knowledge of food safety and equipment safety.
* Experience leading and driving development projects.

**This is a full-time consultant position through Incluso in Lund.** **Start is ASAP, One year's limited contract to begin with, possibility of extension after that.**


Please submit your CV as soon as possible since we will review the applications on an on-going basis.


For more information about this role, please contact Kanika Singhal at kanika@incluso.se, recruiter at Incluso.

title: Data Scientist
description:
We are now looking for a Data Scientist / Data Engineer with an edge in graph technologies to join our Applied AI team here at Stiftelsen Chalmers Industriteknik!

**About the role**  

As a Data Scientist / Data Engineer, you will work on a range of projects as part of our Applied AI team. As a Knowledge Graph Engineer, you will help us build and maintain scalable, intelligent data solutions in the health space. You will be involved in the hands-on development of both internal and external projects, applying data science techniques and machine learning to help solve real-world challenges.


**Key Responsibilities**

* Design, develop, and maintain knowledge graphs, ontologies, and semantic models.
* Integrate structured and unstructured data sources to enhance interoperability and data linking.
* Implement graph-based machine learning and reasoning techniques.
* Work closely with data scientists, software engineers, and domain experts to build AI-driven solutions.
* Optimize query performance for large-scale graph databases.
* Ensure data quality, consistency, and adherence to semantic web standards.
* Stay up to date with emerging trends in knowledge representation, linked data, and AI.
* Participate in other data science and applied AI projects, both internal and external
* Develop and implement data models / machine learning techniques, and data-driven solutions

**About You**  

We are looking for someone with a solid background in data science and graph technologies. You are skilled in problem-solving, service-oriented, and capable of working in a structured and independent manner. You also communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical individuals. Flexibility and the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously will help you succeed in this role.

**Qualifications**

* Master’s degree in data science, or related field.
* Strong experience with RDF, OWL, SPARQL, and other semantic web technologies.
* Hands-on expertise with graph databases such as Neo4j, GraphDB, or Amazon Neptune.
* Proficiency in Python, Java, or another programming language commonly used for data engineering.
* Knowledge of ontology engineering, and data modeling.
* Experience integrating knowledge graphs with AI/ML pipelines.
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in interdisciplinary teams.
* Prior work experience in the health care sector and practical knowledge about LLMs are highly advantageous.
* Good language skills in English, both spoken and written.

 **Employment Details and Application Process**


This is a permanent, full-time position (standard office hours) based at our office in central Gothenburg, near the Chalmers campus. A six-month probation period applies.


Application deadline: **March 28th.**

We will review applications and conduct interviews on an ongoing basis. Emphasis will be placed on personal suitability during the selection process.

 **What We Offer**  

At Stiftelsen Chalmers Industriteknik, we offer a dynamic and innovative environment within an expanding organization focused on problem-solving and creating a sustainable future. Here, you’ll have the chance to leverage your skills while also finding opportunities for personal and professional growth. Join our growing organisation and you’ll enjoy benefits such as flexible working hours, a generous holiday allowance (30 days), a company pension scheme, a great wellbeing passport, lunch time training, monthly massage at the office - the list goes on!

 **Contact**  

If you have any questions about the position or Stiftelsen Chalmers Industriteknik, please feel free to reach out to:


Bernd Ketzler, group manager Applied AI – bernd.ketzler@chalmersindustriteknik.se  

Susanna Turja, HR partner – susanna.turja@chalmersindustriteknik.se


We look forward to your application!

 **About us**  

Stiftelsen Chalmers Industriteknik is a research and development organization dedicated to driving innovation for a sustainable society. We are a passionate team of innovators, researchers, and project managers driven by the desire to make a difference for the future. By enhancing Sweden's capacity for innovation and making research accessible, we work to shape a better and more sustainable world. We are preparing tomorrow for the future.

title: Embedded Software Integration Engineer
description:
**Techster Solutions** befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst **10****+** års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.

  

Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.

 **Rollbeskrivning**:


Manage and configure the software platform and integrate application software components and the software platform into complete node software. Verify the software platform. This includes software build environment and continuous integration/deployment. The Embedded Software Integration Engineer also develops the embedded software technologies and the software platform. Lead ESW integration in a technical team and play an active role in the delivery. Integrate deliveries from others. Responsibility for securing quality and readiness before release. The deliveries are often focused on the early phases of the development cycle, developing technical roadmaps. Network across the organization, as well as influencing the work in the other sites. Develop acquired competence, as well as participate in the business development.
  

  

On Expert level the employee is a recognized expert in Embedded Software Integration Engineering typically obtained through advanced education and work experience.
  

  

* Experienced project lead and an established coach, mentor and educator to others in VG
* Known subject matter expert and a natural goto person for complex discipline related issues
* Strong Tshaped profile (either building deeper discipline excellence or developing mature generalist toolbox)
* Known product owner, often contributing to project roadmaps/strategies within context of industry trends
* Clear articulation of value creation by joining up the dots between their work and the TD/BA strategy.
**Ansökan**  

Tror du att du är **Techster Solutions** nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.

**Arbetsplats och kultur**
--------------------------


Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.


Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Engineering Manager
description:
**Engineering Manager**


The interest in flight simulation is soaring, and so are we! Navigraph is currently looking for a Engineering Manager to join our team in Gamla Stan, Stockholm (soon Norra Bantorget as we’ve grown out of our current office space). This is a newly created, excellent opportunity for someone who wants to work in a mid-size albeit growing company, serving 1.3 million passionate flight simulator pilots worldwide. ️

**About Navigraph**


Navigraph is where the flight simulation community finds its wings! ️ We’re a SaaS company providing aviation fans and aspiring pilots with charts, navigation data, flight planning tools, and training material. Our users fly everything from Microsoft Flight Simulator to X-Plane. With our Electronic Flight Bag, virtual avionics, flight planning tools, performance calculators, and teaching material we’re the trusted co-pilot for any serious virtual aviator. We have a modern tech stack for our main apps based on React and Angular, and also specialized GIS data pipelines and highly performant simulator integrations based on Rust and WASM—all with a strong focus on usability and modern design. Our mission? To make flight simulation as realistic and immersive as possible by making data, software, and tools like those available to the aviation industry accessible for flight simulation gaming. Check out our career site for more information on who we are .


As **Engineering Manager** at Navigraph, you’ll lead and grow one of our two Software Development departments of currently 6 team members plus some international long-term consultants. You’ll manage and mentor our software developers, contributing to our technical and product strategy, and ensuring the delivery of your departments' high-quality, scalable solutions.  

  

You’ll work closely with our Management team, your peers, Tech Leads, Product Owner as well as teams at Navigraph who are maintaining key projects such as our Charts, Hub and Simlink applications, our developer portal, and the APIs powering the large third-party ecosystem. You will play a vital role in developing our passionate and inclusive culture.

**What You’ll Do:**

* **Lead and Mentor:** Inspire, guide, and develop a team of talented software developers incl. Tech Leads.
* **Foster a Positive and Inclusive Team Environment:** where individuals feel valued, empowered, and motivated to perform at their best.
* **Promote Cross-functional Collaboration:** ensuring seamless communication and alignment with other departments.
* **Resource & Team Planning:** Ensure workload distribution across teams, support internal mobility, and help resolve staffing challenges.
* **Conflict Resolution & Coaching:** Address team dynamics, resolve conflicts, and ensure developers feel supported.
* **Enable a Creative Learning Culture:** Encourage innovation and experimentation, cross-collaboration, and knowledge sharing with continuous feedback and reflection, ensuring everyone contributes to their best level.
* **New Talent:** Provide and collaborate with management regarding hiring decisions and undertake recruitment processes.
* **Onboarding:** Oversee onboarding and mentorship for new employees.

**Who You Are:**

* A strong leader with a passion for team development best practices.
* Proven experience in people management.
* Strong communication skills with the ability to connect with both technical and non-technical team members.
* Comfortable balancing strategic leadership with problem-solving.
* Experience in scaling teams – You’ve worked in agile or hybrid-agile environments and have built high-performing teams.
* Experienced in agile development.
* We have a diverse team. English and an understanding of cultural differences will be crucial.

**Bonus If You Have:**

* Technical background with experience as a tech lead, or engineering manager (e.g., software engineer, architect, or similar role).
* An active flight simulation interest

**What We Offer:**

* **Flexible Work Options:** Choose between on-site and hybrid.
* **Work-Life Balance**: Flexible hours and part-time remote options.
* **Perks Galore:** A great benefits package; please check out our career site.
* **Professional Growth:** We’ll support your continuous learning and development with the resources you need to thrive.

### **How to Join the Team:**


We’re reviewing applications faster than a Cessna on takeoff - so don’t leave us hanging in a holding pattern too long! ️ Apply now and help us take Navigraph - and flight simulation - to the next level!

title: R&D Team Manager – HVDC Control & Protection System Solutions
description:
**Location:**

Ludvika, Dalarna County, Sweden
**Job ID:**

R0053638
**Date Posted:**

2024-07-02
**Company Name:**

HITACHI ENERGY SWEDEN AB
**Profession (Job Category):**

Engineering & Science
**Job Schedule:**

Full time
**Remote:**

No
**Job Description:**

**The opportunity**

At HVDC R&D Control and Protection System Solutions, part of the Technology & Solutions Development (Business R&D) organization, we specialize in Real-Time Hardware-In-Loop innovation and development. Our cutting-edge solutions are the foundation for commercial HVDC projects, enhancing Hitachi Energy’s HVDC Control and Protection System offerings.


HVDC technology has been a market leader for 60 years, enabling renewable energy integration and supporting the transition to a sustainable future. Learn more about our world-leading technology at Hitachi Energy HVDC.


Come and join us as an R&D Team Manager in our global and dynamic team of 50+ colleagues, based in Sweden and India. This position will be based in Ludvika, Sweden and, you shall have the opportunity to be a servant-leader to a team of about 15 talented colleagues.


**How you will make an impact**

* Lead an R&D team, managing planning, execution activities, and resources
* Ensure the quality, cost, and timeliness of deliverables, and stakeholder satisfaction
* Foster cross-functional and cross-technology collaboration (e.g., product management, portfolio management)
* Promote sustainable competence and talent development
* Create an inspiring team vision aligned with the organization’s strategy, encouraging innovation and operational excellence
* Uphold Hitachi Energy’s core values of safety and integrity, taking responsibility for your actions and caring for colleagues and the business

**Your Background**

* Master’s degree with a strong technical background in power systems or software development, preferably in HVDC, FACTS, etc
* Passion for people and technology, with strong collaboration and decision-making skills, and the drive to succeed in a dynamic environment
* Prior experience in R&D and people management is preferred
* Proficiency in English is required, as you will be part of a global company

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More about us**

  

Are you ready for an exciting new challenge? Does the above description sound like you? Welcome to apply for this position!  

  



Recruiting Manager, Aditya Deb, aditya.deb@hitachienergy.com will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives – Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 29 86; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43. All other questions can be directed to Talent Acquisition Partner Ingrid Schjelderup, ingrid.schjelderup@hitachienergy.com .

You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**
